Job_Title: Locum CPI Technician - Blood Supply Management
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) Blood Supply Management (BSM) Division is looking for a pool of locums (hourly rated, with shift allowances) who are interested to work in a laboratory setting in supporting the national blood program and to augment the manpower at the Component Processing and Inventory (CPI) Lab. HSA BSM is responsible for the processing, testing, inventory management and distribution of blood and blood products from whole blood donations. All blood units that are collected are processed at the CPI Lab on a daily basis, Mondays – Sundays. On job training will be provided. Interested applicants should respond to the job advertisement with an attached CV. This position is intended to be on temporary contract, for up to 11 months. Successful appointee will be appointed under a contract by a recruitment agency. Shortlisted candidates would be contacted within 30 days from the closing date of the advertisement. We regret that only shortlisted candidates would be notified. What you will be working on Responsibilities:- Basic whole blood separation into blood products, Sorting and packing of blood products/ blood sample tubes to the respective storage areas, Electronic labelling of blood products, Processing of red cells and plasma products, Laboratory equipment operations and daily maintenance, Support general laboratory functions e.g. temperature monitoring and recording, quality data recording , general cleaning etc. What we are looking for Requirements:- Open to work in a laboratory setting Able to work weekends and afternoon shifts Fully vaccinated against Covid-19 We welcome tertiary students and individuals with flexible schedule and able to commit to 21 hours per week to apply. Working Schedule: You will discuss this further with your assigned lab supervisors. Min. 4 hours per work day, 1 - 3 days per week Max working hours per week: not more than 21 hours Morning Shift : 8.00am to 6.00pm (4-8 hours shift) Afternoon Shift : 1.00pm to 10.00pm (4-8 hours shift) Note: Peak period of BSM is Friday to Sunday and peak working time is post blood runs from the collection sites.

Job_Title: School of Engineering - Research Staff (Cost Effective Durable Antimicrobial Coa
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Research Staff (Cost Effective Durable Antimicrobial Coating) What you will be working on Work on fabrication, characterization and performance testing of metal oxide-based nanowire coating for antimicrobial applications. Job_Title: Development Partner/Senior Development Partner, Business Environment & Resources
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Business Environment & Resources (BER) team is looking for a new member in our team. BER’s goals are to study the impact of various domestic regulations on local enterprises and their business costs, and to enable an environment where local enterprises can thrive and grow. In the face of cost pressures in Singapore, BER also ensures that SMEs have continued access to land and space to grow their businesses. What you will be working on Your role will involve the administration and review of land policies relating to the industrial property market to ensure sustained economic growth and creation of good jobs. In addition, you are expected to support industry officers in their engagements with local enterprises on land and regulatory matters. What we are looking for You must be passionate about helping businesses - particularly local SMEs - succeed, so that they continue to create good jobs for Singaporeans. You should be curious and willing to explore new ideas. You should have an analytical mind: able to research thoroughly, find sources of data, and make connections to prove your case. Job_Title: Development Partner/Senior Development Partner, Scale Up (Enterprise Leadership)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is About Enterprise Singapore's Enterprise Leadership The Enterprise Leadership department in Enterprise Singapore (ESG) supports business leaders of promising small and medium enterprises in achieving the next bound of growth. This is achieved through close partnerships with institutes of higher learning, public and private sector partners with the necessary expertise and capacity to deliver, and alignment of interests, to help business leaders grow their businesses. What you will be working on We are seeking a dynamic and motivated team player to join us in shaping and executing value creation initiatives at scale, with the objective of helping Singapore enterprises in their next phase of growth and transformation. This position is for a self-starter who is able to understand and manage multiple stakeholder demands whilst having an appreciation for business growth and strategies in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. Key Responsibilities include ▪ Developing strategies and action plans to grow and nurture our community of promising Singapore enterprises ▪ Working closely with Programme Managers (Institutes of Higher Learning) and ESG business units such as Industry Clusters, Global Markets and Programmes & Policies teams to (i) plan and execute programmes that will enable scale and systematic execution; and (ii) assess and identify promising enterprises for deeper engagement and support ▪ Facilitating connections across promising enterprises and the programme's wider networks to enable peer learning and collaboration, and access to commercial opportunities ▪ Providing timely reporting of programme feedback and management of data, which includes Programme Partners' deliverables and fund disbursements ▪ Assessing, monitoring and sharing the impact and effectiveness of the programme of both qualitative and quantitative data What we are looking for 3 years of public and/or private sector working experience, with a focus in commercial roles (e.g. business development, corporate strategy, partnerships and project management) Preferred Attributes include: ▪ Strong business judgement, collaborative mindset with experience in managing diverse stakeholders ▪ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ▪ Strong organisational, written and communication skills ▪ Analytical mind and meticulous with strong attention to detail ▪ Ability to work under pressure ▪ A passion for public service and in championing the growth of local enterprises

See job description for details The ideal candidate should be an experienced and innovative cybersecurity professional who can be a Cybersecurity Domain Subject Matter Expert that understands the security landscape, architectural models and solutions credibly, and possess exceptional stakeholder management skills to present to C-level stakeholders and technical members. The professional needs to advise and deliver solutions and operational strategic outcomes across the heterogenous environments of Governments / Public Sectors and its challenging environments. The candidate should be an experienced, competent professional with knowledge across multiple disciplines of cybersecurity and operations. Skill and Attribute for Success The Security Delivery Architect (SDA) needs a depth of knowledge and experience in two or more of the following core security domains: Application and Database Security, Infrastructure and Network Security, Regulatory Compliance, Anti-Malware, Incident Response and Managed Security Services. The SDA should also be able to speak to the breadth of the landscape at an introductory level as well. He or She will provide expertise through delivery of workshops, as a senior member of MSS and consulting engagements, and as a leader on solution design, deployment and operations. The SDA possesses the ability to generate high quality artifacts such as requirements gathering, high level and detailed technical designs and deployment plans. As a SDA, he or she will lead during the cyber security project implementation stage. The SDA acts as a primary trusted security advisor to our customers for all technical & security related issues. Identify business critical operational items which can impact projects delivery so that mitigations can be identified to ensure a smooth and satisfactory resolution. SDA is required to work closely within the MSS, CPS, Presales and Senior Management to assist with our customers on new and existing project delivery. SDA should be willing to work flexible hours on occasion, travelling to different sites and occasional weekend/ Public holiday work may also be required. Responsibilities: The Security Delivery Architect (SDA) responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: • Manage and maintain a professional business relationship with our customers through regular communication, on-site meetings and executive briefings. • Lead and drive cybersecurity solution within the customers' environment. • Provide proactive technical guidance to customers to drive security operations excellence. • Be responsible for the design of complex security solutions that integrate from (Application, Network, Cloud) ICT (Information Communication Technology) and OT (Operation Technology) components into an effective and efficient cyber security design. • Lead in initial solution design, project plan & costing. • Undertake complex customer requirements gathering and scoping. • Deliver customer workshops and presentations as required. • Understand & assess the Technical & Security Value of our customers and act on any risks uncovered. • Drive best practices and minimize the probability of security incidents occurring across our customer. • Track & manage any assigned actions for customer and ensure that customer receives high quality support from all departments within NCS and vendor. • Work closely with other departments & functions within NCS to ensure that clear and concise communication is managed for our customers. • Ensure that relevant customer information is continuously communicated to other departments, and ensure that customer receives documented updates in a timely manner. The ideal candidate should possess: • Strong skills in technical & security capabilities like Identity and Access Management, Data Security, Infrastructure Security, SOC build, and Incident response. • Vast consultative and customer fronting experience (Government customer experience is a plus) along with a customer focused background with a strong commitment to customer success & satisfaction. • Excellent verbal and written skills including report writing and presentation skills. • Experience with various Perimeter defence and North-South and East-West threats and mitigations solutions, EDR Systems, Anti-Virus systems, knowledge of SOC environments, GRC, Security Operations, Application, Data or Infrastructure or in related roles. • Deep Experience in the design and deployment of technology and solutions in at least two of the core domains: Network and Infrastructure Security, Endpoint Security, Security Consulting, Incident Response, Threat Detection, Mobility Security and Managed Security Solutions and cloud security solution. • An understanding across breadth of technology domains, and understanding the inter-relationships between major components • Solid understanding and experience working large scale and complex solution delivery and PMP methodology. • Vast experience in developing and implementing security operations and technology in large, complex enterprises in multiple industry verticals, across a wide range of technology platforms. • Demonstration of innovative security, and resilience to solve complex challenges. To qualify you need to have: At least 8-10 years of experience working as a security implementation or delivery capacity. At least 8-10 years of experience working in an operation capacity related to two or more of the following technologies: Web Application Firewall, Database Security, Web and/or Mobile Application Security, Anti-Malware Solutions, Managed Security Solutions and cloud security solution. At least 8-10 years of experience working in an operation capacity related to two or more of the following technologies: Perimeter security, Network Security, Endpoint Security, Application Security,Data Security, SOC Services, Managed Security Solutions and cloud security solution Previous experience working on government projects specifically in the cyber security domain and Governance, Risk Management and Compliance is an added advantage. Experience in delivering and operating cyber security and technology strategy across many different industry sectors. Experience in developing and implementing security operations and technology in large, complex enterprises in multiple industry verticals, across a wide range of technology platforms. Experienced working across diverse teams to facilitate solutions. Experienced working with Security practitioners. Experienced working with Network and Application operations personnel. Experienced with modern versions of Linux/Unix and Windows operating systems. Experience and proficiency in public speaking and can hold own in senior-level presentations and discussions. Experience in defining security, strategies, and assisting with driving aligned outcomes. Experience in a CIRT/SOC environment. Practical experience with threat actor tactical, techniques and procedures (TTPs). Experience with threat hunting. What we looking for • Strong communication and presentation skills. • Comfortable working in a project based / client serving model. • Drive pursuits and engage in complex projects, matching outcomes to expectations. • Ability to work with diverse and dynamic teams. • Ability to work in a matrix organisation. • Ability to mentor/coach delivery team. Ideally, you'll also have • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or other related fields. Professional security related qualification (i.e. CRISC, CISA, CISM, GCIA, CISSP, CEH, PCNSE, CCSE, , Pen Testing, Incident Response etc.) will be an advantage.

Job Description - Engineer, Yield Defect Density (22000642) About GLOBALFOUNDRIES GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com. Introduction: We are expanding our Fab Operations and are looking for Integration and Yield Engineers Your Job: Run DOE to optimize process margins and determine process & ET specifications Monitor OOC, maintain good CPK for ET and monitor inline SPC parameters Identify and resolve process integration issues and ET related problems Identify yield opportunities and set preliminary yield targets Run prototype lots on new or derivative processes Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs Required Qualifications: PhD/Master/Degree in Microelectronics/Electrical/Electronics/Chemical Engineering or Science in Physics/Material Engineering or related field At least 2 years of relevant fab experience Preferred Qualifications: Strong understanding of device physics and SPC will be an added advantage Good interpersonal and effective communication skills Strong analytical, presentation and problem solving skills Able to perform under face paced and challenging environment GLOBALFOUNDRIES is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard. As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities. All offers of employment with GLOBALFOUNDRIES are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, valid work passes and medical screenings, as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations.

Responsibilities: Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 6-10 years of experience Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis Education: Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience Master's degree preferred Role: Liquidity Electronic Execution Business Analyst Job Overview: Business Analyst to join the Cash BA/PM team which primarily consists of resources across London, Belfast, Dublin, New York, Toronto, Tampa, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Pune. The primary responsibility of the successful candidate will be to work on detailed business analysis and project management of projects for the Cash Low Touch Electronic Execution stream primarily in the Asia region, with many projects having global impact. This will require frequent interaction with stakeholders at many levels of the organization, from junior analysts to senior management, across multiple departments including the Front Office Business, Middle Office, Finance, Compliance, Technology, and external vendors. The successful candidate will report into the Global Head of Low Touch BA/PM lead. Duties & Responsibilities: Business analysis effort to deliver critical projects Requirements gathering to Citi standards Management of project deliveries - business, tech mandatory and regulatory, as assigned Resolve day-day project issues and conflicting workload priorities Reporting on project statuses, next steps and issues / risks to stakeholders and sponsors Assisting and supporting user community with change management - Overseeing production of test cases - Ensuring release contents understood by the business, including producing release notes - Tracking release cycles Knowledge, Skills and Experience Required: Experience: Significant Business Analysis / Project management experience across the full project lifecycle (requirements, design, development, testing and deployment). Proven delivery record of managing multiple projects involving process change and technology enhancements. Electronic execution exposure, particularly in the Cash Equities area around Central Risk, Algorithms trading, SMART Order Router , market data , connectivity & reference data Strong knowledge on managing the low latency infrastructure project for electronic execution platform Understanding of regulatory constraints and experience in delivering regulatory projects is extremely desirable Detailed and specific experience with the full Cash lifecycle required Skill set requires evidence of : Ability to handle complex projects independently Problem-solving and facilitation skills Knowledge of the key functions and processes of Cash business Self-motivation and prioritization of tasks and actions to hit deadlines according to business priorities Strong inter-personal skills Enthusiastic and proactive approach Good attention to detail and relevant product knowledge Job Family Group: Technology Job Family: Business Analysis / Client Services Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Employee Compliance Manager Employee Compliance Manager Singapore As a Barclays Employee Compliance Manager, you will work within a centralized risk management and control function, which works in partnership with business and functional Compliance areas to deliver transparent, efficient and innovative solutions in support of the Bank's second line of defense. The integrated functions help Barclays to manage firm and personal conflicts more effectively while ensuring employees continue to uphold the Barclays Values and Behaviors. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Providing coverage on employee compliance activities such as clearance of requests, exceptions including issuing breaches Understanding, explaining and advising on Employee Compliance policy requirements within the team itself, to the Compliance department more broadly and Barclays employees as required Embedding and ensuring high control standards and high quality work product through four eyes checks and supervisory reviews. Attending relevant group calls as required both Locally and Globally Supporting the development of activities relating to Employee Compliance Surveillance Managing various key strategic initiatives and independently working on key deliverables both locally and globally Assisting with the quality assurance of Employee Compliance functions Assisting with any technology project including User Acceptance Testing (UAT What we're looking for: 5+ years' experience in financial industry which includes 3+ years in Compliance Experience of working with global teams and leading strategic projects within a matrix organization Proficiency in application of the various MS Office Tools (i.e. PowerPoint, Access etc.) Post-Graduate degree or equivalent experience Skills that will help you in the role: Knowledge of Employee Compliance areas such as Personal Account Dealing, Private Investments, Outside Affiliations, Gifts and Entertainment, Registrations and Breach Management Ability to interpret complex regulatory concepts and translate into simple summaries Ability to analyse and interpret regulatory rules and their impact on the business Good understanding of core investment banking business lines and products, including equities, fixed income, commodities, banking and financing activities Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Job_Title: MGR/AVP, Group Tax Advisory, Group Finance - (210002J9)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Finance looks beyond providing numbers. We add value in the decision-making process and facilitate the formulation of effective business strategies. We uphold the integrity of our financial records and ensure that the highest standards are applied in our reports. We provide financial analyses and insights to management and businesses to make informed decisions. We engage our stakeholders regularly to keep them abreast of the Bank's financial performance and development. This position will report to the Head of Group Tax Advisory. Key Responsibilities: International taxes including transfer pricing Assist in the design and implementation of new BEPS Pillar Two roll out for the Group Consolidate data for BEPS Pillar Two reporting and carry out related data analysis for effective tax management Assist in the implementation of transfer pricing policies for the Group as well as prepare transfer pricing documentation for the Bank Assist in transfer pricing related queries and provide solutions that are commercially viable Collate data for preparation of revised Country-by-Country Reporting schedules for submission to the IRAS and carry out related data analysis for transfer pricing risk management Corporate and Other related Taxes Perform role of dedicated Tax Relationship Manager to designated Business/Support Units including designated OCBC Branches and OCBC Subsidiaries in regions where there is no tax team. The role requires providing tax briefings/alerts, guidance on tax compliance and tax risk management, advisory on tax related matters and support on new initiatives/projects. Work with Businesses to identify projects that may qualify for government grants and incentives and assist in their applications Liaise with relevant parties in Business, Operations and Finance on the preparation and review of India and Taiwan corporate tax filings Support projects that may require research and understanding of new tax rules e.g., Tax implications of IBOR transition Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: Good degree in Accountancy, Business or Finance and/ or a member of a recognised tax practitioner association Minimum 4 years of tax experience in a Big 4 accounting firm and/or in-house tax function in a bank Candidates with experience in corporate tax and/or transfer pricing may apply for the role Possess strong tax research skills and able to provide practical solutions in commercial environment A self-starter, independent and motivated staff who is comfortable dealing with senior Business people Strong written and verbal communicator At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Get to know the Role: We are living in exciting times. Technology is reshaping how we live and we want to use it to redefine how financial services are offered, which is why Singtel and Grab are coming together. Singtel is Asia’s leading communications group connecting millions of consumers and enterprises to essential digital services while Grab is the leading technology company in Southeast Asia offering everyday services to consumers. Together, we have big dreams to unlock and financial inclusion for people in our region is just one. We want to build a digital bank with the right foundation - using data, technology and trust to solve problems and serve customers. As a Regulatory Compliance Senior Specialist, you will be part of the compliance function where you will advise, assist and support various stakeholders (including business and operations) in the conduct of their mission for digibank so that they can comply with the applicable laws and regulations. You will be primarily involved in the maintenance and implementation of the country compliance programs, including compliance policies and guidelines, regulatory documentation, and compliance training programs. The day-to-day activities include: Provide advice and guidance to internal stakeholders (including business and operations) on applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures; and acting as a contact point for compliance queries; Be able to assess and interpret the potential impact of applicable financial regulations and rules on business and product development; Evaluate and review new products, services, and operations (including marketing materials and advertisements) to ensure due compliance with internal policies and relevant laws and regulations; Coordinate closely with subject matter experts to implement risk mitigation strategies in key areas such as personal data protection, transaction monitoring, business continuity and information security. Conduct periodic compliance risk assessment to review the appropriateness of the compliance programs including compliance policies and procedures, follow up on any identified deficiencies and formulate proposals for amendments; Prepare periodic compliance reports/presentations for regulatory bodies and senior management forums. Develop training materials and regularly sensitise senior management, relevant employees and business partners regarding key compliance risks and applicable regulatory requirements. To record, update, disseminate and advise the various units / departments of any implications of new regulations/ regulatory changes and provide guidance on the proper and prompt implementation of policies and procedures to comply with the requirements. Assist in the investigation and reporting of any breaches of regulatory and market conduct requirements and internal policies and rules (e.g. via complaints received) and follow up on resolutions; and Assist with liaising with the relevant external bodies including regulators, standard setters, and external experts, where required. The must haves: A University Degree with a focus in Law/Risk Management/Finance. At least 10 years of relevant working experience in providing regulatory compliance support in the financial services sector such as banking, financial advisory and capital markets. Must have relevant local consumer / SME banking and other financial sector experience with a deep understanding of the Banking Act, Financial Advisers Act, Securities and Futures Act, and other industry compliance practices. Ability to interact and communicate well in writing and verbally with broad ranges of audiences including Senior Management and stakeholders from various business functions. Must be able to collaborate with various senior stakeholders from other functional teams. Possess a strong analytical ability, good problem-solving skills and must be meticulous. Proven experience in engaging and maintaining good relationships with regulators. Preferably to have knowledge or skills in using technology like data analytic tools to analyse or monitor potential compliance risks. Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) environment. Should have a deep desire to excel and develop a career in a fast growing tech company. Should have demonstrated integrity and respect in the performance of their duties.

Get to know our Team: The Benefits team, under the People Rewards and Organisational Planning function within People Operations (Pops), partners closely with Pops teams in each location to design and operate Grab’s benefits programmes that are both relevant to our local Grabbers and consistent with Grab’s global benefits philosophy. In this role, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to drive the design and implementation of new benefits programmes across Grab, working closely with internal Pops teams as well as external vendors. The day-to-day activities: Lead the implementation of new regional and local benefits programmes and ensure relevance to local market practices and compliance with legislation. Bring Grab’s global benefits philosophy to uplift the benefits for Grabbers everywhere. Conduct benchmarking exercises and market research to ensure a competitive benefits offering. Provide benefits analysis and insights to drive benefits programmes in Grab. Create Grabber awareness through engaging and creative communications of our benefits regionally. Experience in handling employee insurance remarketing and renewal exercises. High business acumen to build business cases for benefit programmes. Logical and creative in innovating and designing leading edge benefits programmes. Passion to drive benefits that make a difference to Grabbers' daily lives. Resilience in facing failures and constantly iterating for success. Collaborative attitude in working with stakeholders both within/outside of Pops and Grab. Ability to go deep into operational details and process flows. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient in GSuite and Microsoft applications. Strong quantitative and analytical skills. Good project management skills are needed in prioritizing and managing multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Education
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on As a member of the Education team, you will manage companies in the Education sector, which include various types of education services companies ranging from early childhood, preschool, to enrichment and training and adult education. Developing good relationships with the companies and relevant industry stakeholders is key to ensuring timely, insightful and meaningful engagement to drive industry growth and economic contributions to Singapore. You are required to understand the enterprises' growth plans and strategies, and identify areas of assistance to facilitate their capabilities upgrading, growth and overseas expansion. Being able to provide the best possible execution for projects and dynamic management of relationships to ensure the most satisfactory outcome for the sector is necessary. Your role includes developing and delivering sectoral programmes, managing projects and stakeholders, and promoting the adoption of best practices for the industry. Education Technology (EdTech) is a key enabler for the education industry and is increasingly playing a prominent role in delivering effective learning outcomes and deepening engagement among parents, teachers and students. You will also be involved in the exciting role of developing and managing the EdTech eco systems and its incumbents, enabling partnerships and collaborations between EdTech and the education corporates for innovation and growth. What we are looking for You should be results-oriented, able to demonstrate strong business acumen and strategic thinking. Good communication and writing skills, and the ability to perform under pressure will put you in good stead. You must be able to work in a collaborative environment but also able to independently organize and deliver on the assigned projects. Some business travel for this role would be required. Candidates with three to four years of relevant working experience in the Education sector would be preferred.

Job_Title: School of Applied Science - Research Assistant (Formulation & Nutrition Science)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Research Assistant (Formulation & Nutrition Science) What you will be working on Work with the project leaders and co-project leaders to achieve the aim of the research project. Carry out research work on alternative protein, food processing, microbiology, glycaemic index, sensory and other quality test of food products. Coordinate with external collaborator on project development. Document, collate, analyse and interpret data. Assist in procurement, including liaising with vendors, sourcing for materials, equipment and testing, and raising purchase requests. Document and track project issues, expenses and budget tracking, action logs and equipment maintenance. Assist in preparing progress reports for regular project updates. Perform any other related duties assigned by the project leaders and co-project leaders and Reporting Officer. What we are looking for Relevant qualification in food science, nutrition, life science, microbiology, chemical engineering or equivalent areas. Prior experience with food processing, product development, microbiology related work (e.g. media preparation, subculture bacteria, plate count, spectrophotometry, microscopy), quality control/assurance of food, would be an added advantage. Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong working relationships with people at all levels. Possess good multi-tasking skills, with a strong sense of responsibility for completing assigned duties on time. Possess basic knowledge in food hygiene and food safety practices Good documentation skills, laboratory techniques, proficient in MS Office, research and data analysis skills. Successful candidate will be employed on a contract basis.

What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. What you will be working on Lead and oversee the daily operations of a team of actuaries. Provide leadership and technical guidance to the team, including nurturing and developing them. Review actuarial analysis (e.g. premium calibration, rebate distribution, valuation) for CPFB-administered insurance schemes. Assess key financial metrics, and provide quality recommendations for policy reviews and risk management. Implement processes and procedures’ review to ensure that CPFB-administered insurance schemes’ objectives are met in an efficient and effective way. Actively engage key stakeholders to achieve holistic and effective outcomes. Lead in projects that support the Board’s initiatives. What we are looking for - Candidate with Mathematics/Actuarial/Statistics/Economics or any related certification. Attainment of Actuarial Fellowship is a plus. - At least 12 years of actuarial working experience in areas including valuation, pricing and experience studies. Experience with IFRS 17 implementation is a plus. - Proficient in actuarial software. Analytics and statistical programming skills (e.g. machine learning, Monte Carlo simulations, R, Python) are a plus. Strong understanding of the application of current regulatory framework as well as industry practices. - Resourceful, meticulous, self-starter and has strong leadership skills. Able to influence and negotiate effectively with stakeholders. • Excellent communication (both written and spoken) and organisational skills.

What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. What you will be working on We are looking for junior and experienced data scientists. You will work with diverse teams in the Board, from scheme implementers to policymakers and corporate service providers, to translate their business needs into actionable data projects. You will apply your quantitative expertise to help them make data-driven decisions and increase the effectiveness of their processes. Your projects and insights will be presented to, or shared with the Board's senior leadership, and also publicised more widely throughout the Singapore Government. Quantitative studies include, but are not confined to the following: Perform simulations and econometric studies to advance policy innovations to improve the retirement adequacy of CPF members Analyse randomised controlled and natural experiments to improve the way we communicate with CPF members Conduct predictive analytics to automate manual processes, assess the retirement landscape, and perform more targeted outreach Use natural language processing to automate text-related processes and provide insights on trending issues Utilise cluster analysis to identify groupings of CPF members for policy and outreach interventions What we are looking for Possess strong statistical knowledge and proficiency in applying quantitative models Familiar with using statistical software like Python, R, and Stata Able to create engaging data visualisations, tell impactful data stories, and write in a concise yet compelling manner Enjoy building relationships with people from diverse job functions to understand and pre-empt their analytical needs Able to work independently to scope and drive own projects

Job_Title: Senior Executive, Field Resource & Recruitment - Consumer Insights
Job_Descriptions: Company Description We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at NielsenIQ: https://nielseniq.com Job Description ABOUT THE ROLE The Field Resource & Recruitment team serves a crucial role in supporting fieldwork and ensuring that logistic works for Quantitative projects run smoothly and professionally under our fast pace business. He or she is expected to take an active role in planning and manage time to be able to support a number of logistics works from different projects that mostly come at the same time with minimal mistakes in a timely manner. RESPONSIBILITIES: As a Field Resource & Recruitment Senior Executive you will be responsible for the following: Recruit suitable interviewers and contractors to work on assigned projects Ensure on-time and high-quality recruitment Coordinate interviewers training sessions, conduct induction/project training and manage onboarding paperwork Manage administration, contractor payroll and purchasing tasks Update system, manage welfare and disciplinary oversight of interviewers Visit fieldwork sites (island-wide locations including the air, land and sea checkpoints) to conduct site training or witnessing Lead the Field Resource & Recruitment team, including coaching team members, reviewing and optimising processes continuously, and act as point of liaison amongst various stakeholders representing the Recruitment team Interviewer Recruitment, Training & Management: Prepare job descriptions and manage job advertisement postings to ensure steady in-flow of candidates Screen candidates and accurately assess suitability for projects Schedule interviews, briefings, trainings and initiate administrative tasks to onboard and equip contractors to work on projects Conduct Induction/project training and ensure all contractors understand the NielsenIQ Code of Conduct and Field Standards and Policies, including confidentiality and security requirements Update system for resource allocation at project level, and monitor quality and productivity via feedback from Project team Coach, counsel and re-train contractors as necessary; document all performance and disciplinary issues Perform Validation Checks on interviewers work and accompany/observe a sample of their interviews Provide deserved recognition and ongoing performance feedback to Interviewers to improve their morale and motivation, and encourage continuous improvement Administrative tasks: Assign and manage field inventory including contracts, IDs, policies, passes, PPE training, ART kits, tablets etc Manage and maintain up-to-date and accurate contractor database for contractor evaluation Ensure timesheets, claims and expenses are verified, authorised and submitted for processing Communicate the following to Team leader and CI Ops Leader in timely and objective manner: Concerns regarding training and/or project requirements Work-related incidents, including security incidents Risk & Process Management Proactively identify and manage resolution of risks and issues that may negatively impact a project deliverable Seek and implement innovative ways to remove project obstacles Escalate project issues and risks as appropriate Develop business continuity plan to enable business to recover from an emergency or disaster Ensure that all internal systems and documentations are appropriately updated in a timely manner Continuously aim to deliver projects to the highest quality possible Communication Conduct regular project reviews and be well-informed on status of projects Document, share and leverage project lessons learned and promote best practices for continuous improvement Facilitate strong cross functional communication by building strong working relationships across departments Maintaining internal and external communications, including regularly updating project progress and building trust with all stakeholders People Management Provide support, recognition and feedback to assist employees to achieve their performance standards Act as coach, guide and mentor to address professional development goals and needs of direct reports Ensure proper dissemination of information and implementation of company rules, regulations, policies and procedures given the wide-spread of operation associates Qualifications REQUIREMENTS: Minimum diploma qualifications in any discipline 3+ years’ experience in market research industry Strong communication and “people skills”; able to effectively problem solve and diffuse potential conflicts Organised with strong time management skills; proactive and able to meet deadlines and follow-up on action items Detail-oriented, both in receiving and giving instructions Good command of English and local language(s) (verbal and written) Additional Information About NielsenIQ NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge.  We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com. NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

RESPONSIBILITIES: As PM Executive (Questionnaire Development & Output Delivery) you will be responsible for the following: ●       oversee the design, development, and finalisation of the online or offline questionnaires for Consumer Insight ●       assume complete ownership of assigned questionnaire/s in the context of preparation via questionnaire by objective (QBO) guidelines, the design and flow of questions, look and feel based on methodology and target respondents. ●       work closely with operations project management teams on identifying & reconciling field quality issues, identifying main objectives study and driving continuous improvement ●       be proficient in various quality tools as well as solid data analysis skills and have excellent problem-solving skills including root cause analysis & process improvement ●       able to use and operate systems or tools to track data fluctuations, addressing fieldwork issues through data analysis ●       bridge the communication between client service and statistician, and together decide follow-up action to resolve data fluctuation & outliers ●       bridge the communication between client service and data processing in charting task and building the dashboard. 1)        Questionnaire Design ●         Serve as primary contact of Client service, PM, and programming team on assigned project / questionnaire ●         Be directly accountable for assigned tasks in terms of questionnaire design and development ●         Communicate questionnaire concerns and/or changes to appropriate team members. QD must ensure all changes are reflected in the final questionnaire 2)        Link testing ●         Ensure that the questionnaire link received from the programmer is tested within 24 hours (before the Interviewer briefing) ●         Link for the Interviewer briefing should be tested and approved by QD before use ●         Ensure that the changes in the questionnaire after briefing (if any) is communicated to the Programmer/ Project Manager/Client Servicing and reflected in the link ●         Ensure that the final link is checked versus the final word/EZQ copy of the questionnaire to ensure that all questions and instructions are captured ●         Ensure that questionnaire link for fieldwork is checked and approved by QD before use 3)        Functional / Technical ●         Maintain an accurate and up-to-date knowledge on research techniques and applications ●         Learn and master survey authoring platform for efficient, quality and timely delivery of final questionnaires for the field. ●         Client engagement - discussions with client on questionnaire design requirements as needed ●         Manage assigned project independently ●         Perform quality checks on all questionnaires for alignment to accuracy and correctness ●         Ensure standard operating procedures within area of responsibility are observed ●         Take part in the maintenance of an accurate, complete, up-to-date questionnaire bank for reference ●         Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility 4)        Implement quality assurance procedures in accordance with data collection methodology ●         Ensure investigation is appropriately conducted considering robust analysis, documentation of root causes and identifying potential risks to fieldwork quality; Job Description ABOUT THE ROLE The Automation & Digital Acceleration Executive plays an enabler role in the Operations team, fostering efficiency and materializing possibility and productivity, to support the Operations project teams and their delivery to clients’ delight and satisfaction. The ideal candidate should have a good grasp of skills in at least one programming language, is open-minded to learn, and possesses creative problem-solving skills. RESPONSIBILITIES As an Automation & Digital acceleration Executive you will be responsible for the following: Develop systems and applications through an agreed concept with Microsoft Power Platform Provide support to the CI Ops team to work more measurably and easily carry out the processes that run in each department Management of existing systems and tools: Enhance and build upon existing technical systems Build and develop tools to accelerate the process Review, learn and manage local launch of new tools from regional/global teams if any Conduct research on the technology products that will benefit clients and the team. Manage the local user pool on all designated platforms Learn, test and deploy updates to platforms. Inform all stakeholders as needed Plan and conduct training when needed Work closely with Operations, Commercial, Vendors and Platforms and Tech teams as needed Support for End-to-End Process in CI Operations: Ensure Automation runs well and according to CI Operations needs in order to improve quality, efficiency and productivity. Work on new initiatives automation – accelerate digitization and automation in CI Operations Design tools to bring about efficiency and productivity as required in projects Create or develop products to support CI Operations needs Responsible for the accuracy of the data used as the basis for automation running in CI Operations Manage the performance indicators of each stakeholder in CI Operations as a basis for measuring CI Operation performance in general Qualifications REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s Degree is required from an accredited college or university Strong technical, analytical, logical and problem solving skills Proficient in writing scripts on any of: VBA, JavaScript, Office Script A solid understanding of the principles of market research Open-minded to learn new skills and technology Work well under pressure Good interpersonal skills and able to work effectively with co-workers Well organized and able to meet deadlines Good command and communications in English Motivated by efficiency and a strive for delivering continuous, highest possible quality Additional Information About NielsenIQ NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge.  We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com. NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Design, Creative Singapore, Singapore Description About us The company is an integrated communications agency that has gone from start-up to multi-national in a little over two decades. The company now ranks in the top 40 agencies worldwide and has 24 offices. Its success is due to a combination of factors: talented people delivering award winning campaigns; expanding client relationships into new markets or services; making strategic acquisitions. The agency, its people and client campaigns have won many prestigious awards, including Cannes Lions, Holmes Report, ICCO, PRCA and European Excellence. Purpose of the role The Art Director supports on creative programs, including strategy and tactical implementation, for TEAM LEWIS and its integrated clients. You will work closely with the Creative Director to manage the creative vision, look, feel and tone of our clients’, and our own, identity online. You will be responsible for leading, developing creative guidelines and directing creative work. The Art Director is an expert in all facets of the creative process — and the creative industry — in order to produce the best work. Collaborating with office heads, local market creatives, client servicing team and other marketers on a daily basis, this person is a conceptual thinker with a keen business sense and the ability to sell creative ideas to clients. Key responsibilities and tasks Client Management Leads a fully accountable strategic relationship with the client, providing insight, expertise and partnership across a wide variety of creative services Responsible for ensuring excellent client communication at all levels; defining KPIs, deadlines and service agreements for the team Drives the delivery of an added-value consultancy and works closely with clients to deliver campaigns, services and products across traditional and emerging creative technologies, both on and off-line Supports the new business process in collaboration with the Creative Director APAC, Futures Hub team and local office heads in selling TEAM LEWIS creative credentials throughout the tender process Creative Services Interpret creative briefs to provide clear understanding of objectives and work required Ability to develop creative ideas and concepts with an emphasis on compelling ideas align to business goals, ensuring efficient and effective delivery by the team Conceive, develop and produce the overall look and feel of advertising campaigns and other projects Oversee campaigns through the production stage to completion Sells creative opportunities within existing accounts and leads clients to uptake creative solutions Ensures a consistent level of service, quality and creative output from the team Provides strategic insight and direction for new business pitches and internal communications Introduces new technologies and development platforms to the team, with a view to supporting emerging client needs Keeps pace with external creative trends/culture and shares this knowledge with the creative team and local colleagues Channels Works collaboratively with the client servicing team to increase the utilisation and selling of digital services Partners with the client servicing team to develop innovative, compelling and impactful creative content for both current and prospective clients Measures client growth and impact across internal and external accounts Team working and development Defines deliverable client objectives and sets standards of excellence for all client activity, driving commitment from all levels of the team Monitors team activity levels against budget, increasing fees and negotiating with clients and suppliers where necessary Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendor Supports in the new business process, project managing pitch teams and delivering credible solutions to new business challenges Acts as a respected line manager (where applicable), working closely with line reports to maximise strengths, improve weaknesses and support career development Work with the People team to reward, retain and develop the team and resolve any performance issues Reporting and analysis Ensures profitability and efficiency on all accounts and effectively manages budgets Understands and maximises the impact of client revenues on the wider business Communicates account performance internally and provide strategic advice to the client based on measurable analysis Monitor and report back on account KPIs and ensure accurate reporting by junior team members Provide detailed reports to the TEAM LEWIS senior management team on request General Lead and train regional creative teams to develop innovative design solutions, from broad concept development through to solid implementation Runs and supports training sessions, with a view to maximising opportunities to expand team skills and grow revenues Takes a proactive role in promoting the TEAM LEWIS brand, its identity, values and work Supports the people team by promoting both internal and external opportunities at TEAM LEWIS across social media and via the referral scheme About you Minimum of 3-5 years experience in an Art Director role in a digital/integrated agency Well versed in all disciplines of design (Branding, User Experience, Art Direction, Communication Design, Moving Image etc) Proficiency in design principles (Typography, Composition, Scale, and Colour Theory amongst others), and working knowledge of how those principles work together, in particular for digital touchpoints In depth understanding and ability of latest design softwares, including Adobe Creative Suite Pixel-perfect attention to detail Solid art direction craft skills in being able to bring creative concepts/big ideas to life in compelling ways Lateral thinker - able to connect external design trends to actual briefs and objectives Experience working on campaigns and design projects within multiple markets in the APAC region Confident in presenting, sharing and reviewing creative work with functional teams: including Creative Director, Account Servicing, and other regional stakeholders Calmness under pressure and ability to deliver to tight deadlines Excellent communication skills (written and spoken) - being fluent in English is a plus This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of the responsibilities for this role. Other responsibilities may be added from time to time. TEAM LEWIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating and fostering an environment focused on equality, empowerment and respect. We strive to create an inclusive workplace that supports and celebrates our diversity. We continue to invest in our efforts to ensure that TEAM LEWIS is a place where everyone can thrive.

A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 58,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others. What You Do The Validation Engineer is a subject matter expert in equipment validation and computer system validation and oversees and/or executes validation projects in their area(s) of expertise at our Singapore site. This position is responsible for the oversight of vendor and contracted validation resources. This role will also be responsible for supporting the day to day operations within the site Facilities and Engineering department. Reporting into the Manager of the Facilities and Engineering department, the Validation Engineer is responsible and accountable for the successful execution of all validation works, and meet regulatory requirements according to the prioritized timeline. The validation works may be executed by the Validation Engineer and/or managed by the Validation Engineer employing contractors or OEM vendor technicians. Brief role description: Defines, plans and manages validation projects while meeting applicable regulatory requirements. Executes and manages validation activities as defined in the project plan. Receives minimal supervision. Ensures the timely delivery of validation deliverables to allow for validation peer review and QA approval to be completed within the project schedule. Acts as a team member in the selection, design, and implementation of new or updated laboratory equipment, controlled temperature units, and/or other hardware to be validated or used in at the facility. Works with the global Validation network to develop life cycle documentation and validation standards. Contributes to long-term planning for the Systems Validation business model including team goals, metrics and budget. Works on problems of complex scope in which analysis of the situation or data requires a review of identifiable factors. Interacts with outside customers and functional peers groups (System Owners, IT, QA) at various management levels to gain cooperation, foster collaboration and influence project outcomes. Support the department with preparation for Client/Regulator Audits. Ensure validation activities are controlled in line with BioReliance Quality Management System, and client Quality Agreements.Analyzes validation related problems/issues, implements validation related event, CAPA. Develop and provide metric reports, provide periodic communications to all equipment owners on the status of validation activities. Performs tasks in accordance with SOPs and regulations (cGMP, GLP, BSL-2). Implements planned activities. Ensures company health and safety regulations and procedures. Perform other related duties within scope of the Facilities department to include oversight of system maintenance and calibration. Who You Are Degree in Science, Engineering or Computer Science. Preferably more than 2 years of validation experience in a cGMP Biologics/Pharmaceutical manufacturing/laboratory environment Subject matter expertise for validation of equipment and/or computer systems used in a GxP environment. Working knowledge of Biologics regulatory environment and GMP manufacturing topics Understanding of operation of BSL-2 Lab environment is highly desirable 1-2 years project management experience would be a plus. 2-5 years experience with either computer systems, analytical equipment and/or controlled temperature unit qualification would be a plus. Excellent communication, problem solving, customer service and planning skills. Demonstrates technical proficiency, scientific creativity, and collaboration with others and independent thought. Ability to exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate actions. What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!

Job_Title: Senior Specialist, IT Risk Management & Security
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Senior Specialist, IT Risk Management & Security (Risk Analyst) THE OPPORTUNITY Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on The Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021). Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years. Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation. WHAT YOU WILL DO •    Guide stakeholders in the compliance of company policies, procedures and external regulations. •    Driving adherence to Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) •    Provide IT risk advisory to divisional stakeholders. •    Conduct and coordinate IT risk assessments and treatment discussions with consideration for organizational policies and external laws and regulations which apply to the business environment. This includes working with the IT organization and peer risk organizations to identify IT Risks globally and to provide consultative services to assess and prioritize those risks. •    Support and improve the organization security posture in the region including emerging and high-growth market by managing the risks to an acceptable level. •    Ensure consistency in security collaboration with enterprise risk and other functions. •    Support the secure adoption of new and emerging technology, i.e. Social Media, Mobility, Analytics, and Cloud Computing. •    Ensure compliance with corporate information security policies and other industry standards. •    Contribute to enterprise-wide risk mitigation programs, processes and technologies focusing effort on identification of the highest risks. •    Serves as an expert on IT Security and Compliance policies.   Maintains current state awareness and understanding of internal and industry practices relative to IT security & compliance.  Knowledgeable of evolving trends, industry citations, etc. •    Elevate IT security awareness in general and targeted audience within the organization, service providers and other vendors. WHAT YOU MUST HAVE To be successful in this role, you will have: •    Bachelor’s degree or higher in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Business or equivalent is required. •    Require at least 8 years of cyber and risk management background and preferred with over 10 years of total experience. •    Solid working knowledge of Risk Management and Cybersecurity tools & processes. •    Strong background working in a risk, regulatory, and compliance environment. •    Significant experience in leading cross-functional project teams with limited direct line responsibility and exceptional project management skills. •    Experience implementing systems utilizing SDLC methodology in a regulated environment. •    End to End mindset – a relentless ability to connect people, processes and information. •    Awareness of relevant industry business, information and technology trends, in and out the industry. •    Deep understanding of multi-cultures in the region and able to effectively work with various stakeholders. •    Relevant certification credentials are desired such as CISA, CISM, CRISC and CISSP. •    IT background in infrastructure or enterprise systems environment. •    Technical knowledge and understanding of SDLC and regulatory principles. •    Hands-on experience with computer systems and security tools. •    Demonstrated skills working with various IT technologies and services. •    Familiarity with advanced/emerging technology trends. •    Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of virtual teams in a fast-paced environment. •    Must be able to adapt and rapidly learn new technologies and apply their findings to solve key business challenges. WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT Opportunities across various functional group within biopharmaceutical manufacturing Diverse and dynamic team that focuses on development and success. Our Support Functions deliver services and makes recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the experience of working at our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security. WHO WE ARE We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world. WHAT WE LOOK FOR Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today. We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. Current Employees apply HERE Current Contingent Workers apply HERE Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company.  No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails. Employee Status: Regular Relocation: No relocation VISA Sponsorship: Travel Requirements: Flexible Work Arrangements: Shift: Valid Driving License: Hazardous Material(s): Number of Openings: 1 Requisition ID: R149378
