The Role: Director - Credit Product Specialist The Location: Singapore /Australia The Team: S&P Global Market Intelligence's Product Specialist organization supports S&P Global's objective of developing and delivering integrated data, research, and analytic solutions to our clients globally. The Impact: A Senior Credit Product Specialist is expected to drive the success of SPGMIs ' Credit Risk Solutions business through Southeast Asia & Pacif ic through leveraging deep industry experience, core product knowledge , confident communication, and leadership . Reporting to the the Senior Manager APAC Credit Product Specialists , the mandate is to demonstrate leadership, strate gic execution , collaboration, and performance in partner ing with a range of stakeholders. A primary focus for the role will be to deliver commercial performance across S&P Global's Credit & Risk Solutions capabilities within APAC . You will provide expert market, industry, and product knowledge to deliver complex solutions across credit assessment data, tools, and analytics. The role focuses on the credit risk management workflow supporting CROs , CFOs , Credit Analysts & Credit Risk Managers across a range of financial and non-financial service industries. This includes but is not limited to supporting loan origination, monitoring default risk of customers and counterparties, identifying opportunities to invest in fixed income markets, underwriting specialty insurance policies, pricing intercompany loans, raising debt capital, and further more, facilitating the assessment of E, S and G factors in these decisions. Strong familiarity with global and regional bank capital regulatory frameworks . What's In It for You: • The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work with the credit products of one the foremost recognized brands in the world, learning about the technical aspects and best practices of how creditworthiness for counterparty risk is assessed. • This is an energetic and highly skilled team within Asia-Pacific, that are positioned as subject matter experts, allowing the successful applicant to help raise the standard of performance and shape the future direction for the product specialist team. • This role provides great exposure to a broad range of clientele across industry segments, including global and regional regulators and policy makers. It also provides great visibility within the organization across both the commercial and product verticals. • The role also provides the opportunity for publication of thought leadership pieces, which are often presented at conferences, webinars, and workshops that we participate in. Responsibilities: • Develop and lead market- base d campaigns and tactical initiatives across client segments to increase market awareness and drive revenue growth. • Develops and implements process and product improvement initiatives and standardizes complex sales to improve replicability and market penetration. Participates in and oversees collaboration with commercial, product and other functional partners. • Ensures the alignment of team efforts toward commercial strategy and Go-To-Market campaigns. Stays well connected to strategic customers in the market. • Provide a tactical view of commercial a n d product strategy to help translate, design and execute pre-sales/post-sales implementation plans. • Promotes S&P Global Market Intelligence thought leadership. • Serve as a Credit Product and Industry subject matter expert across functional groups. Collaborate internally to design and deliver training and where required deliver client workshops. • Continues to build on advanced knowledge of the industry and awareness of market trends across Southeast Asia and Pacific . Keeping abreast of the latest regulatory changes while understanding relevance and opportunity to our business , including those relevant to ESG, climate stress testing and scenario analysis etc. • Build a demonstrated proficiency in all S&P Global Market Intelligence credit capabilities. • Maintain a keen awareness of competitors and relative strengths. • In depth knowledge of client segment workflows: Corporates, Investment Management, Commercial Banking, Investment Banking and Private Equity. • Ability to design and lead complex negotiations of client workflow solutions. Focuses on more sophisticated and complex c lients' engagements. • Provide leadership to team members and liaise s with senior commercial management regarding technical challenges , commercial and product strategy for prospects and clients. • Establishes internal stakeholder relationships with sales representatives, relationship managers, product managers, marketing, and commercial directors to diagnose, design and deliver workflow solutions for more complex clients. • Provides inputs to Product teams based on market/client feedback on our various credit products to help improve and innovate our product offerings. • Bring a unique dimension to a high performing team through solid credit knowledge and is required to perform as a critical resource for functional teams. Qualifications : • A minimum of a bachelor's degree with a Masters/ MBA, advanced industry certification (CA, CFA, FRM), or technical degree is a plus. • 8+ years relevant industry experience and a proven record of accomplishment in complex technical sales. • Minimum of 8 years in sales or product specialization , preferably in credit research and risk management. • Effective communication skills, both orally and in writing. Public speaking skills and the ability to deal with people at all levels within an organization are expected. Proficiency in English is expected and ability to communicate in an additional regional language is a plus. • Experience in a direct credit risk assessment/management, lending, capital markets or consulting role. The Role : To provide in-depth coverage of Asia's generation fuels markets with a focus on natural gas and LNG, and lead Platts' market moving LNG news coverage in Asia, in tandem with the leading JKM LNG price benchmark. You will create breaking news, analysis, interviews, features; and digital media such as blogs, podcasts, infographics and videos. You will track day-to-day developments of the LNG market, and monitor a range of underlying supply demand fundamentals from the power sector to competing fuels like coal and renewables. You will work with the pricing team and Platts analytics, and write authoritative stories on short and long term LNG market developments. Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 10 Location : Singapore The Impact: You will maintain Platts' high journalistic standards, practices and policies, ensure our LNG coverage is ahead of competitors and advance our reputation as the commodity news provider of choice. The Career Opportunity : This is a unique opportunity to gain recognition as an authoritative voice in the global LNG space. You will have the opportunity to network with the most influential names in the LNG industry, and work with an impactful team of global news and market reporters. You will have access to Platts' entire range of LNG market intelligence, and use story telling tools ranging from data journalism to video interviews. The Team / The Business : The global energy news team works closely together in what is a fast-paced environment, including real-time market coverage as well as longer term analysis. You'll report to the head of generation fuels news in Singapore and work with other local news and market reporters/editors. Your Skills : Relevant LNG or energy/commodities reporting experience. Strong English language editing, writing and reporting skills. Data analysis capabilities. Highly motivated, productive team player able to pivot quickly in response to a fast-evolving daily slate of stories. Responsibilities •Develop Generation Fuels & LNG Market Content As a writer and editor, you will ensure that LNG news from the Singapore energy news desk is timely, unique and relevant. You will be responsible for creating content and presenting it in a way that has maximum impact. You will monitor news flow from competitors, prioritize daily content and help conduct forward planning of event and story coverage. You will track a range of related sub-sectors like LNG shipping, downstream demand, upstream investment, gas derivatives, etc. • Content Presentation You will be required to think innovatively on how best to present the content to make it impactful and reader friendly. This could involve the use of infographics, maps, charts, tables etc. • Content Generation You will be required to collaborate with regional colleagues, market reporters and other members of the energy news team to generate and drive content. This could be in the form of further analysis of developing news and/or writing features. • Market engagement You would be expected to develop and maintain productive relationships with a broad base of key industry sources. S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We're the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. The Role: Senior Communications Manager for S&P Global Market Intelligence (MI) will manage MI's internal and external communications activities throughout APAC as well as lead key strategic initiatives globally and report into the Global Head of Communications for MI based in New York. You will work in close alignment with teammates in the U.S., London, and India, as well as our strategic communications teammates in APAC-all part of the unified global communications team at S&P Global. The Impact: APAC is a key strategic region for S&P Global Market Intelligence and S&P Global at large. Our presence in China, Singapore, India, Pakistan and Australia, among other APAC countries is well-established, and we have a large growth opportunity for our communications in this region. You will get to be part of the numerous plans which are underway to strategically support and expand our thought-leadership position in the region and will be tapped to lead larger global initiatives. You will have close interaction with members from the MI Leadership Team to help build and manage their internal communications objectives. You will also manage and grow strategic press relationships in the region on behalf of Market Intelligence, resulting in increased data and analytical citations in target press outlets. This is a highly visible role within MI and the company at large. The Career Opportunity: You will have a chance to develop and apply skills across both internal and external communications. While a majority of the work will focus on APAC, you will have also have global responsibility of one or more strategic initiatives/areas of the business. The Team / The Business: You will be a member of the MI Communications team - a global team of communicators who are highly motivated, collaborative, results-oriented and well-respected amongst senior stakeholders. You will also provide back-up support to the other members of the team who are based in APAC across other S&P Global businesses and at times- other targeted APAC countries. Our Hiring Manager says: "I'm looking for someone who is a self-starter with strong communications and relationship-building skills. Due to the time-zone differences, I need someone who the team can trust to execute and deliver with minimal guidance. You will represent MI Communications as you work closely with our company's most senior business leaders throughout APAC, as well as interact closely with top tier media. I value teamwork, accountability, effort and a hunger to learn and grow every day." Develop and lead outreach plans and media activities in APAC, including occasional travel as needed. Develop and execute internal communications plans to promote key leaders, division initiatives or communicate change management. Partner with support teams to lead develop and lead function and business line town halls Contribute to team's overall tracking and reporting of communications metrics Work closely with SPGMI's marketing team and key thought leaders/ group leaders to develop comprehensive strategic outreach plans for key initiatives; ensure appropriate PR strategies are aligned with marketing activities. Work on ad hoc projects as needed including speech writing, key messaging development, and panel preparation. Job_Title: Associate/Associate Director, Infrastructure and Utilities Ratings
Job_Descriptions: The Role: Associate/Associate Director, Global Infrastructure and Utilities Ratings Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 11/12 The Location: based in Melbourne or Sydney The Team: Standard & Poor's is looking for a highly skilled individual to join our Global Infrastructure Utilities Ratings group as an Associate Director who will lead a portfolio of Infrastructure and Utilities credits, including corporate entities and project finance. The Impact: You will be able to demonstrate analytical excellence, and good presentation skills in front of internal and external audiences and maintain and enhance the quality and timeliness of our analysis. Moreover, you must demonstrate an ability to represent S&P Global Ratings in a highly professional manner to global issuers and investors. You will be required to prepare meetings with senior management teams to extract and assess information relating to credit quality. Strong organizational skills are also required to support senior analysts and work on multiple assignments. The Career Opportunity: This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a high performing global analytical team, covering a sector undergoing important changes and with good potential for professional development. The Australian market is again experiencing high growth rates as local economies recover from the effect of COVID-19 pandemic lockdowns and M&A activity has increased significantly. The position will also be part of the larger APAC Infrastructure team and be able to work on ratings in Asia as well. We expect infrastructure development will surge as countries are poised to grow quickly, especially given the increased vaccination rollout. Key responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Conduct analysis on complex infrastructure and utilities assets, make recommendations and present to rating committees. Be a subject-matter expert to provide analytical input to credits covered by other analysts. Act as a senior member of rating committees and be responsible for convening and conducting rating committee deliberations in area of expertise. Effectively communicate to clients Standard & Poor's methodology and procedures. Be a senior representative in meetings with issuers and investors on analytical matters and assist in resolving clients' analytical needs. Contribute to Standard & Poor's global and regional analytical forums, and publish related commentaries. Skills & Qualification: Bachelor's degree. Advanced degree, or CFA charter is a plus. Minimum eight to ten years of experience in an analytical position. Working experience in the infrastructure industry is a plus A passion for credit and financial analysis A demonstrated ability to give effective presentations to senior executives Strong financial statement analysis skills and accounting knowledge Strong interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills A highly motivated team player who can work autonomously in a global, multi-cultural and fast-paced environment Ability to lead rigorous analytical work and lead the publication of timely commentaries Note : candidates with lesser experience will be considered for Associate role About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world's leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. Job_Descriptions: S&P Global Ratings The Role: Digital Content Editor (1 Year Fixed-Term Contract) Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 10 The Location: Hong Kong, Singapore, Sydney or Melbourne The Team: Our team is dedicated to providing correct, concise, and compelling content. Job_Title: Assistant Manager, Distribution Compliance Surveillance Officer
Job_Descriptions: Our client is a renowned financial institution seeking meticulous, systematic and detail-oriented individual with high level of integrity to join their exciting team. You will be responsible to perform proactive monitoring to support early detection and intervention of potential misconduct or market abuse issues by distribution representatives. You will perform compliance review and monitor the compliance requirements of the distribution representatives for Regional Agency/FA & Bancassurance as the first line of defence. Job Description Study trend analysis on key risk indicators to identify emerging risk of misconduct or new initiatives and leverage findings from various data sources to identify areas of concern requiring further investigation, and to identify clusters of issues or risks Review the generated report outlining all transactions with deviations and review the documented justifications. Elevate transactions with potential misconduct for further investigation in a timely manner Conduct pre-transactions checks on selected representatives, and perform sample service calls to customers from these selected groups, as well as representatives flagged through analytics and agency group with certain targeted criteria Findings from the service calls in the Compliance Review Report to be shared with agency leaders to reinforce areas for improvement and conduct reviews to monitor if the agency force have duly fulfilled the regulatory requirements as set out in the company guidelines. This includes the review of documentation such as coaching forms and Joint Fieldwork Assessment Maintain awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company also highlight any potential concerns/ risks and proactively share best risk management practices Requirements Degree holder in any discipline Minimum 3 years of experience in any investigations role. Experience in audits with financial services or insurance industry would be an added advantage CMFAS qualification (M5, M9, M9A and HI), AFP or AFC professional qualification would be a plus Inquisitive and curious to delve deep into data to investigate trends or anomalies. A natural curiosity to identify and explain trends and patterns in data and an ability to analyzes and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication Visualize and communicate findings and data insights to various stakeholders in a coherent and logical manner

Job_Title: Senior Associate - Real Assets, Fund Accounting
Job_Descriptions: SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services. Job Description Position: As a Senior Associate, you will play a critical role in the success of our business. You will be part of a dynamic and fast-growing team of fund experts, reporting directly to the Manager - Real Assets. On a typical day you will be working on a wide range of diverse and varied projects including: Client Management Provide quality fund administration services for our clients, manage and maintain good and stable client relationships Support team members in interacting with clients and counter-parties including legal counsels, auditors and tax advisors to meet key deadlines Supporting the Associate Manager in the operational onboarding of new clients including coordinating client acceptance/onboarding process, agreement on services delivery per SLA Play a key role in smooth onboarding of new clients by obtaining and furnishing the complete set of onboarding documents to the Compliance team Accounting Preparation of general ledgers, sub ledgers and trial balances for multiple international distribution notices, NAV statements, partners’ capital statements, management accounts etc. Calculating management fee, carried interest workings along with the schedule of waterfall (fund as whole/ deal by deal) Facilitate the annual audit of the funds with communication with auditors Preparing GST Statement of Claims and liaise with the tax agent for providing the relevant information for filing ECI and Form C-S Support treasury and related services for the clients Operational efficiency & team management Contribute and identify opportunity for the development and implementation of adequate and effective processes to improve the overall operations Pro-actively take on additional responsibilities and tasks from time-to-time as required by your Managers or clients Support the implementation of new process and procedure within the team Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. Job_Title: PB APAC Risk - Senior Business Manager
Job_Descriptions: Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer This role is required to support the head of PB APAC FLDS and PB APAC Head of Competency Centers (CoC) to deliver team's mandate and drive management rhythm to ensure sustainable & compliant growth and proactive risk management. Your future colleagues PB APAC FLDS maintains effective risk governance & control framework, monitors > 70 business risk metrics and top key risks. The teams are also responsible for critical remediation, change and business-as-usual risk deliveries with focus on FCC, Investment Suitability, Controls & Monitoring etc and managing periodic updates to key local / global partners as well as regulators as and when required. You Offer No Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Job_Title: Senior Manager Credit Risk Review CPBB
Job_Descriptions: Senior Manager Credit Risk Review CPBB About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Strategy This is a role for an experienced professional providing technical expert-based assessments and support to the risk review team on a global group-wide basis. The candidate will assist CRR CPBB (Consumer, Private and Business Banking Review) team in providing management with an independent assessment of the quality of specified portfolios, their risk governance and the degree of alignment between strategy and delivery. SCB has been building new partnerships and optimizing existing ones by leveraging the power of data for acquisition, underwriting, collections, fraud detection, pricing, etc. The role will specifically cover emerging risk themes across Digital lending, Crypto and partnership lending models. This will be achieved by evaluating a business's effective risk management control on elements of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework (ERMF), with a principle focus on Credit Risk. The core requirements include: Experience in managing Digital partnerships, unique value propositions and alternate lending platforms Be part of the review team and identify inherent risks across digital lending platforms, alternate data underwriting, strategic partnerships and unique value propositions Business Awareness and understanding of the Group's business strategy and model appropriate to the role and the ability to assess in the reviews undertaken whether misalignments between strategy and stated risk appetite are occurring or are likely to occur. Understand and implement the strategic intent and collective agenda in CPBB Banking Clients globally. Good knowledge, awareness and understanding of the wider business, economic and market environment in which the Group operates in respect of the countries reviewed. Processes Contribute to the continuous improvement of the operational efficiency and effectiveness of the Credit Risk review's risk management processes. Ensure that all work undertaken as a member of the Credit Risk Review function is delivered to the highest standards and within agreed budgets each year. Contribute to the development and maintenance of work programmes which reflect the current business organisation and operating environment. As directed to perform, support and lead the planning, fieldwork and reporting of Credit Risk Reviews engagements to deliver agreed objectives. To identify and escalate significant issues, and ensure these issues are appropriately tracked and followed up. Execute the Credit Risk Review function for CPBB and ensure that the programme of reviews is undertaken in accordance with the approved Terms of Reference for the function. Identify the positive aspects and areas for improvements in businesses, geographies and thematic risk reviews. Provide constructive and independent feedback on risk issues identified and wherever appropriate, recommend the actions that may be taken to mitigate the issue identified; Ensure that the reports of the reviews are written on a timely manner and is succinct without missing the key details required to understand the context of the issues identified Risk Management Maintain and develop personal risk capabilities and skills to meet ongoing needs and plans. Ensure effective management of the operational risks within the Function and compliance with applicable internal policies, and external laws and regulations. Work with CPBB risk review lead to provide an independent assessment of the credit process and governance against the portfolio framework, Group Policies and Procedures, and Group values. Governance Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the business unit's arrangements to deliver effective country level governance, oversight and controls in the business and if necessary to recommend changes in these areas. Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Responsible for delivering 'effective governance'; capability to challenge fellow executives effectively; and willingness to work with any local regulators in an open and cooperative manner. Regulatory & Business conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Valued Behaviours and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Work with wider team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients. Effective Operation of Financial Markets; Financial Crime Prevention; and The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Embed Here for good and Group's brand and Valued Behaviours in the team and the team's output. Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures. The Role Responsibilities Support the Head, Business Continuity & Resilience, TB to implement the CCIB Operational Resilience Framework within Transaction Banking, working in an agile operating model. The Framework will encompass new Operational Resilience regulations, Business Continuity Management, Crisis Management and Operational Continuity in Resolution ("OCIR") across Cash and Trade. The role holder will have knowledge and experience applicable to either Cash or Trade products, or both. Support Product Owners for operational resilience within Transaction Banking to implement and maintain first line risk ownership, CCIB Operational Resilience requirements and Policies/Standards set by the Group Resilience team. Coordinate and participate in Operational Resilience squads in Transaction Banking and collaborate with stakeholders to meet resilience regulation milestones: identify vulnerabilities, set impact tolerances, prioritise improvements, perform stress tests and self-assessment. Provide input into the design and undertake implementation of the agreed resilience Target Operating Model within Transaction Banking Support the Product Owners in development of Transaction Banking resilience capabilities as it applies to Cash or Trade globally and ensure consistent application across country business teams. Leverage capability from the Group Resilience team to ensure best practice, lessons, and capability is shared across the business on design, implementation and maintenance. Support the Product Owners to address critical vulnerabilities to business services across Cash and/or Trade are appropriately prioritized in the relevant QPR. Coordinate with CCIB Operational Resilience and other Business teams to ensure critical dependencies on operational assets outside Transaction Banking are appropriately prioritized in the relevant QPR. Support Head, Business Continuity & Resilience, TB in escalation of risks relating to Operational Resilience to business NFRCs and/or CCIB Operational Resilience as required. Support reporting of Operational Resilience risks and treatment actions to NFRC regularly. Delivery: Provide feedback to Head, Business Continuity & Resilience, TB supporting CCIB Operational Resilience, on the overall CCIB Operational Resilience Framework; Support the implementation of CCIB-wide guidelines, and controls into Transaction Banking, develop and/or adapt training materials and templates for operational resilience to ensure effective integration into business change processes. Ensure appropriate consultation with Regional and Country Transaction Banking stakeholders. Implementation scope includes: new operational resilience regulation requirements; business continuity management; crisis management; and OCIR. Support Product Owners' review and challenge of Important/Critical business services and impact tolerance thresholds proposed by the business. Identify strategic changes or vulnerabilities requiring remediation. Assist implementation of controls within the business to maintain and periodically review Important/Critical business services and Impact Tolerance thresholds as part of the business change management process. Participate in workshops, exercises and scenario testing to identify vulnerabilities in resilience of operational assets. (IT, Data, 3rd parties, people, property etc.) Support the Product Owners on QPR/NFRC submissions related to OR treatment, improvement actions and monitoring of risks. Assist the development of Group Business level response, continuity, recovery, crisis management capability, teams, plans within Transaction Banking Support the design and implementation of monitoring in the business to identify changes to the risk profile of operational assets such as high criticality systems, SLAs, organisational design, movement of operational capability. Support the Product Owners to embed group and country level capability applicable to Cash and/or Trade to respond and recover from natural disasters, market events, external attacks and topical situations such as elections. This includes the development and management consolidated Operational Resilience Response & Recovery Plans, Crisis Management Plans, Playbooks and Runbooks. Coordinate for crisis exercises on behalf of Transaction Banking within the CCIB Crisis Management Group and support preparation for crisis exercises on a regular basis to ensure preparedness for any contingency. Governance: Support the Head , Business Continuity & Resilience, TB and Product Owners on QPR/NFRC submissions related to OR treatment, improvement actions and monitoring of risks. Support the Product Owners implementation of Group policies standards, CCIB Resilience Framework and local regulatory requirements through prioritisation within applicable QPRs and subsequent execution by relevant squads. Understand and assess the impact of changes to Transaction Banking from Resilience policies, standards and CCIB Resilience Framework to ensure the impact is understood. Recommend additions/enhancements/changes to the Operational Resilience policy, standard, guidelines, procedures, and controls as applicable. Monitor Operational Resilience profile and posture within Transaction Banking and report any non-compliance to the Product Owner. Participate and represent Transaction Banking in Operational Resilience working groups to provide updates and influence positive outcomes for the Business. Design and support the implementation of operational resilience KRIs, KCIs and other risk ratings/assessments, as well as process designs using available MI across Transaction Banking Conduct: Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Transaction Banking. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Relationships Head, Business Continuity & Resilience, TB as Transaction Banking Operational Resilience Product Owner Transaction Banking Business and COO teams Product Owner, Operations Resilience, CCIB Operational Risk Group Operational Resilience team Business QPRs / NFRCs Country / Regional - Business Heads, and Country Resilience teams L&D team and Learning Academies GIA, External Auditors Our Ideal Candidate Masters or Bachelors degree 7+ years of Banking experience Cash and/or Trade product and process Knowledge Knowledge of the Global regulatory environment and the ongoing developments Comprehensive knowledge of risk governance frameworks & quality framework and processes Knowledge of process improvement methodologies Proactive and positive with the ability to make good/sound decisions and use independent judgement Project and Program Management skills Data and Management Information design capability Knowledge of all segments in the business and activities with a broad understanding of CCIB Banking business Proven ability effectively collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders Ability to create effective work relationships across functions & borders Assertive, tenacious and willing to challenge when required Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

The Role: Head of Business Continuity Management Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 13 The Location: London, Houston, New York, Denver, Singapore What We're Looking For: We are seeking a knowledgeable and energetic Business Continuity Specialist with excellent business continuity management / disaster recovery / crisis management experience, to develop, maintain and manage the business continuity program of S&P Global Platts expanding global business. The job holder will liaise extensively with all business operations, combining efforts into a single business continuity plan and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards and S&P Global's overall Risk Management requirements. As a business continuity SME you will ensure effective controls are in place and support all activities necessary to enable S&P Global Platts to respond to a business disruption. This is a very challenging role within a thriving and dynamic environment and will require coordination across teams in USA, EMEA and APAC. The Business Continuity Specialist will report directly to the S&P Global Platts Head of Business Operations. Responsibilities: Update BCM policies and procedures Build a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) to assess internal and external threats and the risk they pose to the S&P Global Platts and recommend mitigation strategies to reduce or eliminate identified risks Develop an enterprise-wide BCM strategy leveraging existing efforts and best practices Ensure that all potential business risk factors are considered (loss of access to primary office, transport disruptions, IT failures, data loss, cyber-attack, reliance on 3rd party vendors, key personnel, etc.) Drive and develop the content of BCM plans and documentation for core operational areas which includes, business resumption, recovery, restoration and disaster recovery plans that allows for business continuation in the event of disruptions or disasters Communicate the BCM plans to all relevant stakeholders for signoff Provide education and awareness to all individuals as to the importance of effective business continuity plans and their role in the event of a disruption to business operations Provide overall governance and direction setting of the program on an ongoing basis Drive the delivery of BCM plans to an agreed timeframe Coordinate the activities amongst various BCM work streams and liaise with their BCM counterparts in other divisions Work closely with technology teams to ensure their disaster recovery plans for critical systems and applications are consistent with the plans developed for BCM Provide support in the event of a business disruption to manage the response coordination and communications Coordinate BCP testing program and actively participate in testing scenarios Document any issues experienced and lessons learned in a business disruption / test and track the progress to resolve open issues Ensure that BCM plans are developed to maintain and/or restore business processes within required timescales following interruption to, or failure of, critical business processes Assist with the companies governance structure for crisis management & continuity planning Escalate risks and coordinate mitigating responses Develop status reports on location continuity plans and prepare management reports as necessary Provides leadership and advice to assist other departments with BCM budgets and activities Ensure compliance with evolving regulatory requirements and industry standards Provide subject matter expertise on BCM to include appropriate legal and regulatory requirements Propels other similar facilities programs for occupant health and safety (evacuation drills, coordination of exit plans, and similar) Other duties as requested by supervisor. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor degree of management information system, business administration or related degree and ideally with certificate from a recognized professional BCM body Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in Business Continuity Management / Disaster Recovery / Crisis Management Proven experience in business continuity management/crisis management topics driving the BCM Program through influencing senior business leaders, facilitating decision making and managing cross-functional teams in multi-cultural environment. Good knowledge about ISO 22301 or similar Industry Standards A strong understanding of Operational risk and resilience, Business Process improvement methods as well as risk related control frameworks and practices (COCO, COSO, ISO, ITIL, CMM, COBIT, etc.), Project / Program Management skills - demonstrable track record successfully managing projects at the highest technical and tactical levels, coordinating multi-discipline projects Excellent analytical skills and understanding of processes, risks and controls Exceptional risks and issues management, change control Good communicator Excellent command of English (verbal/written) Highly developed interpersonal skills with ability to effectively communicate and influence decision-making with senior management Ability to work with a global team Energetic, Self-starter, Flexible and Goal-oriented Business minded, well-organized team worker with strong problem solving and leadership skills Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only): S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $121,600 to $252,500 . Job_Title: JJT Sustain Lead Product analyst – EPM
Job_Descriptions: Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science – bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. At Johnson & Johnson Corporate Business Technology, we power J&J employees with technology to shape the future of healthcare. While serving as strategic problem solvers and innovators, we collaborate as trusted allies with leaders and partners across corporate functions, sectors, and regions, aligning business strategies with technology solutions against outcomes that matter. Through Expert Services and end-to-end product management we deliver exceptional user experiences as we simplify, strengthen, and automate the technologies employees use to get their jobs done. In CBT, we know we’ve done our job when the boundaries between CBT and our partners blur and we deliver as ONE DIVERSE & UNITED TEAM with corporate functions including Human Resources, Finance, Global Services, Procurement, Legal, Health Care Compliance, Privacy, Corporate Affairs, Engineering & Property Services and Global Security. As digital leaders, we shape J&J to lead in digital technology – savvy and capable of fulfilling its promise. The technology we are responsible for delivering fuels J&J as we strive to change the trajectory of health for humanity. Do you seek big, complicated, ambiguous problems? Are you passionate about having a significant impact on the experience, effectiveness and efficiency of your colleagues through innovative technology solutions? The Finance function is currently undergoing a transformation of its financial forecasting technology, which launched it's first Minimal Viable product (MVP) in August 2021. In support of this Go Live, the JJT Corporate Business Technology team is recruiting for an JJT Lead Product analyst – Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) who will support the Run State organization. In this role, the Lead Analyst will partner with the Business Product Owners (BPOs) in Finance, with Technology Services, and with our external implementation partner to understand system “bug fixes” that users are encountering. They will also identify any enhancements to improve system performance and user experience. Next to that they will collaborate with the EPM project team to ensure that any improvements are in line with our the EPM strategy and architecture guiding principles. In this position, you will work closely with the BPOs to write business-language user stories, partner with the development team to drive technical delivery of solutions is aligned to those stories and support the testing cycles to deploy these enhancements. This position will be based in Singapore. The person who assumes this role should have the desire to complete an Anaplan training curriculum and become a specialist in the Anaplan technology. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Business Problem Understanding: works with the finance business partners to understand and translate business problems into value case & comprehensive sets of requirements for the planning solution spanning process, technology, data, governance, compliance & user experience supported by defined value realization key performance indicators Internal Partnerships: Acts as the primary JJT collaborator with the business, alongside TPO, aligning on products development needs, for the EPM related products and platforms through the definition, management and clarification of user stories and use cases for complex requirements. Ensures all partners are clear on the roadmap activities, interdependencies & due dates. We believe that current knowledge of industry and business process trends and ability to apply knowledge to existing business processes are essential to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is recommended that you have a knowledge of the enterprise architecture and development methodologies along with a broad understanding of the current capabilities and limitations of existing systems. In addition to these core skills, we would expect you to have the following technical/functional knowledge: -  Financial planning and analysis -  EPM Solutions -  Anaplan, Hyperion, Adaptative Insights, IBM -  HFM, Group Reporting, OneStream -  Understanding of Artificial Intelligence / machine learning -  Human Centered Design Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS -  A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required. Preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business or related field. -  3+ year preferred of relevant experience in defining and documenting requirements and supporting finance function -  Good technical focus with prior work experience in financial planning and budgeting technology solutions, such as TM1, Hyperion, and/or Anaplan, is preferred -  Experience with all aspects of the product development lifecycle as well as Agile methodology is preferred. -  Experience working to bring products/services to market strongly desired. -  Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Primary Location Singapore-Singapore-Singapore- Organization Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435) Job Function Info Technology Requisition ID 2206002170W

The APAC Labeling & Artwork Project Manager is a cross-functional project management role, within J&J Consumer’s Labeling and Artwork Operations - Center of Excellence (LAO CoE), reporting into the Global Program Management Lead. This full-time position is located in the Singapore J&J office & will report to the Global Labeling & Artwork Project Manager based in France. The APAC Labeling & Artwork Project Manager is responsible for: establishing labeling & artwork project timelines by partnering with IMO & regional Franchise being a single point of contact for leading regional franchise through packaging, labeling & artwork content creation, with an end-to-end accountability connected to regional project status through launch. focusing on upstream design & development process for new package design & new labeling content creation. Working from project kick-off through Define, Design & Development stages, ensuring a seamless transition of content to the regional artwork execution process. facilitating the J&J Design Briefing process, Cross-functional Team Status Meetings, Design Approval Process – driving for clarity and locked decisions tracking and transparently reporting to key business partners on project milestone status. initiating a formal escalation process to address critical issues, project scope changes or roadblocks as appropriate with CoE Leadership Team and key business partners. assisting in Global Labeling Artwork Operations CoE change management programs / ongoing process communications & training. supporting the Global CoE on Continuous Improvement initiatives. Proactively identify areas for process & performance improvements, elimination of execution barriers, embraces the idea of trying new processes, new management tools, crafting globally consistent policy across all franchises Main business partners include (but are not limited to): J&J Franchise Project Management (IMO), J&J Franchise Marketing, J&J Design Studio, Package Development, Regulatory, R&D, Regional PMO & Regional Labeling & Artwork Drivers. The role will focus mainly on Skin Health & Essential Health initiatives. The candidate must be a strong group facilitator, communicator and possess excellent Project Management Skills in the New Product Development, New Product Innovation and Lifecycle Management space. Qualifications Minimum of a bachelor’s degree. A Project Management Professional (PMP) certification and/or similar industry certification, i.e. Process Excellence Training, or an MBA is a plus. Minimum 8 years of relevant business experience, including 4+ years of formal project management experience Proven ability to drive process in high complexity environment (multiple stakeholders, global, …) Excellent communication (verbal and written), strong interpersonal and team facilitation skills Organization, rigor, sense of urgency Ability to interact with all levels of management and lead productive discussions without line authority to secure alignment of senior stakeholders. Fluent proficiency in English & Mandarin as this role will be working closely with counterparts in Greater China. Knowledge of the consumer healthcare industry or experience in the OTC / Pharma, Cosmetics or Food industry is a plus. Johnson & Johnson announced plans to separate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned separation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements, and other customary conditions and approvals. Should you accept this position, it is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, you would be an employee of a new entity within New Consumer Health. Primary Location Singapore-Singapore-Singapore- Organization Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435) Job Function R&D Requisition ID 2206003707W

Job_Descriptions: VP, Overseas Branches/Centralised Ops /Grp Finance & Corporate Functions, Group Audit VP, Overseas Branches/Centralised Ops /Grp Finance & Corporate Functions, Group Audit Posting Date: 27-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Audit function is an independent internal audit team that provides objective assurance and consulting to improve and add value to the Group's operations. We help the Group achieve its strategic objectives by adopting a systematic and disciplined approach towards evaluating and improving the effectiveness of risk management, control and governance processes. Job Responsibilities You will lead or participate in audits to assess the Bank's internal control structure, raising awareness of control risk, providing advice to management in developing control solutions, and monitoring the implementation of management's control measures. Besides well verse with Bank's business and processes such as Cash, Trade, Loan and Treasury Operations, you are expected to continuously keep abreast of key regulatory requirements and expectations, especially on AML/CFT compliance. Audit experience and ability to travel (up to 20%) for job assignments are not mandatory but will be an advantage. Job Requirements Recognized university degree, with minimum 8 years of relevant experience in financial institutions from the banking industry. Professional qualification such as ACCA, CPA, CFA and CIA. Good data analysis skill; ability to utilize automated tools to analyse and present business data will be an advantage. Good writing skills, especially in drafting audit reports with clear and concise findings and recommendations. Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills Team-oriented with a strong sense of ownership and accountability Strong communication skill and ability to work in multi-tasking environment Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Descriptions: Details of the Division and Team: The Compliance, AFC and BSCO Business Manager drives the CAO Division in managing all aspects of business management, planning, and strategy. The Business Manager must be able to consolidate the results of a diverse set of activities, whilst managing the ongoing relationship with the senior regional management and the Global Business Management team in order to collate and validate required output and create relevant business insights for senior management. Job_Title: Tenure-track Assistant / Associate Professor, Faculty Position in Emerging Infectious Diseases
Job_Descriptions: Faculty Positions in Emerging Infectious Diseases Tenure-track Assistant / Associate Professor The Signature Research Programme in Emerging Infectious Diseases (EID) at Duke-NUS Medical School in Singapore invites applications from outstanding candidates for tenure-track Assistant / Associate Professor positions within the broad area of virology/emerging infectious diseases. All areas of virology/infectious diseases, especially research directed at unravelling the molecular mechanisms of microbial pathogenesis, virus/pathogen-host interactions and genomics, immune responses to infection, molecular virology, vaccinology, and the role of the microbiome in host susceptibility/response to viruses and other pathogens. All applicants must have a PhD and/or MD, 3 to 5 years of postdoctoral research experience, and a strong record of research accomplishments and publications. Successful candidates will be provided with laboratory space, and access to the state-of-the-art facilities to carry out translational research through our strong links with clinicians through the SingHealth Duke-NUS Academic Medical Centre. We offer an attractive package that includes 100% covered competitive salary and a generous five-year start-up fund. Successful applicants will be expected to establish and maintain a rigorous, externally funded research programme and to participate in departmental teaching and mentoring of graduate and medical students. The Programme in Emerging Infectious Diseases strives to pioneer the development and discovery of new and more effective methods for the detection, treatment, prevention and control of emerging and re-emerging pathogens. EID has a strong core of researchers working on pathogen discovery, virus evolution, structural biology, virus-host interactions, pathogenesis mechanisms, experimental therapeutics, clinical trials and epidemiology. More information is available from https://www.duke-nus.edu.sg/eid. Interested candidates should send an application with their full CV, a concise 1-page research statement and the names of three referees to the Programme in Emerging Infectious Diseases, Duke-NUS Medical School Singapore by email to: **@duke-nus.edu.sg The review of applications will begin on February 1st, 2022 and will continue until the positions are filled.

Job_Title: APJ Strategy Associate, APJ Strategic Initiatives
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary At Amazon, our mission is to be the earth's most customer-centric company. To achieve this, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is continuously evolving, and is a place where motivated employees thrive, and where employee ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. AWS APJ Strategy Associate Role As a full-time strategy associate, you will lead and manage strategic projects to uncover new business opportunities or solve our biggest challenges for Asia-Pacific and Japan (APJ). You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically to identify problems and gaps, collect and analyze data, generate insights, come up with solutions, and implement them. You will execute on your proposed business strategies to solve difficult problems and remove blockers for our customers and our business. You will independently manage projects and run programs to deliver value for our business. To do so, you will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders such as sales, operations, and marketing teams. Through leading initiatives across Asia-Pacific, you will gain a unique insight into the internal workings of the world's fastest growing billion dollar IT organization. Who are we looking for We hire builders and are looking for people who enjoy problem solving and driving initiatives that can create huge impact for our customers and business. The ideal candidate: . Has strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to lead and drive initiatives . Is creative and able to innovate and simplify process . Is curious to learn and comfortable with ambiguity . Has good communications skills . Is analytical and has strong financial/business acumen . Has a can-do spirit with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects . Has outstanding interpersonal skills and is able to earn trust and influence others . Is independent and comfortable with navigating ambiguity . Is highly organized and can multi-task and prioritize competing stakeholder requests . Uses a customer-centric approach to solve problems . Thrives in a lean, fast-paced, entrepreneurial, multi-cultural environment . Has a passion for AWS and driving cloud computing adoption across Asia-Pacific BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . At least 6+ years of work experience in sales/BD, sales strategy/operations, program management, or customer success . A stellar academic and/or professional record . Analytical and quantitative skills and ability to utilize Excel and/or other software to provide data to support your analysis . Excellent English written and oral communication skills . Program or project management experience PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . A master's degree or equivalent experience . Understanding of sales strategy and operations . Experience managing strategic projects from end to end (idea conception to implementation) . Experience working within a high-growth technology company What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Derivatives Regulatory Reporting, Asset Management Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH805284 Jan 28, 2022 Competitive Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with an Asian Asset Manager who is well known for their wide range of investment solutions to both retail and institutional clients. The Singapore team is looking for a Derivatives Regulatory Reporting Specialist to join their Middle & Back Office Services Department. Reporting to the Head, you will be the primary SME in regulatory reporting related projects and provide expertise across derivatives regulatory reporting requirements in multiple jurisdictions. Role and requirements Be the primary SME in regulatory reporting related projects. Keep abreast of the evolution of regulatory reporting requirements and ensure the firm will be able to meet its regulatory reporting obligations and to stay ahead of the curve on new requirements. Perform oversight of regulatory reporting activities undertaken by delegated reporters. Daily monitoring of regulatory reporting activities ensuring timeliness, completeness, and accuracy of reportable trades via Markit MIR. Experience in detecting risks and issues and implement effective controls. Resolve operational issues with the relevant parties as and when they arise. Support Derivatives team with derivatives trades life cycle management and collateral management. Review the oversight process to ensure control framework is adequate at all levels to minimize operational risk. Review and periodically update of internal policies and procedures. Continuously seek to improve on current processes so that there are no major issues observed during audit or reviews. Support new fund launches and transitional activities by working closely with service providers and internal stakeholders such as Transitions Management, Product Team, etc to ensure all regulatory reporting requirements are fulfilled and duly setup for the running of the portfolio. Maintain strong working relationships with all external/internal clients as appropriate, ensuring clear and accurate communication and responding to queries in a timely manner. Work with internal stakeholders and relevant business areas on projects and other firm wide initiatives. Key requirements A Degree or equivalent preferably in Finance/ Accounting/ Data Science. Minimum 5 years' related experience across back-office functions within the asset management industry. Strong understanding of derivatives regulatory reporting requirements in multiple jurisdictions especially MAS and EMIR. Knowledge on SFTR reporting. Experience in managing projects. Strong derivatives products (bilateral/cleared OTC and Exchange Traded) knowledge. Experience in reviewing OTCD documents: ISDA, CSA, CTA, etc. Able to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively to complete tasks within required deadlines. Strong process and systems orientation. Excellent general management capabilities and communication skills. Advanced Excel and Microsoft Office. Knowledge on Aladdin would be a plus. Ability to communicate effectively, strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Highly team orientated. Work towards and share best practice. Meticulous to detail. Ability to work effectively under pressure. Able to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability. Can do attitude. If you are interested in the role and would like to discuss the opportunity further, please click apply now or email Hagen at hlee@morganmckinley.com for more information. Job_Title: Credit Risk Associate, Traded Credit Risk
Job_Descriptions: Credit Risk Associate, Traded Credit Risk Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH801822 Dec 15, 2021 S$5-9k pm Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with a Corporate and Investment Bank with strong footprints and relationship in the Asia region. The Singapore team is looking for an Associate hire to join their Credit Risk department. Reporting to the Chief Risk Officer, you will be part of a team providing expertise in credit risk management of a distinct portfolio of predominantly APAC financial institutions counterparties (country or sector) to ensure they remain within the bank's appetite and minimise credit losses. You will also be given exposure to provide Traded Credit Risk management support for deal clearance requests from Trading & Sales. Role and responsibilities Build and maintain strong relationships with Trading & Sales acting as an enabler with business partners, seeking to find solutions to proposals Demonstrate sound credit judgement in analysis and approval/decline (if required) as part of the annual review process, new transactions and/or excess approvals, reflecting understanding of pertinent issues and risk drivers and in line with delegated authority Proactively manage the credit risk profile of the APAC credit portfolio and ensure that risks are identified, assessed and mitigated to the desired level Identify problem cases, taking action to mitigate risk and ensuring that the appropriate internal governance is followed Provide expert support and advice to the business on the management of the credit risks in the APAC FI portfolio, including interpreting and complying with the relevant risk policy standards and risk management framework, and sharing relevant information as appropriate, g. regarding changes in risk appetite, emerging trends, potential threats and opportunities. Assist senior credit managers to ensure timely and productive kick-off meetings are held with offshore support teams / analysts. Review financial analysis provided by Credit Analysts; providing constructive feedback and coaching, as appropriate, to ensure required standards are met Participate in client due diligence meetings as appropriate / required Maximise cost effective efficiency through contribution to the change agenda, constructive challenge and improving processes Contribute to the development of a 'team working' ethos, take responsibility for own personal development and pro-actively support the team with development where appropriate Act as cover for the Traded Credit Risk Management function by providing timely and accurate credit figures for live deal clearance to Sales and Trading, including providing or facilitating approvals where required Assist the Excess Management team in analysing credit risk breaches Key requirements Credit risk analysis experience (minimum 2 years experience), preferably covering financial institutions Knowledge of key risks in Traded products (e.g. FX, interest rate swaps, Repo, Options) and associated key documentation terms and agreements used Have the ability to work independently with minimum supervision and exhibiting a positive "can do' attitude and willingness to broaden horizons outside of core credit competency required. This includes embracing the integrated (Credit, Market, Operational Risk & Traded Credit Risk Management) operating model for Risk in APAC Have a take ownership and following up mindset and able to work successfully as part of a team and with senior management Bachelor/Masters degree or equivalent professional qualification. DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com that provides a broad set of infrastructure services including computing power, storage options, networking and databases available on demand. We are the leader in cloud computing and our pioneers are embracing innovation, building the future, and making history! Over the past years, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 100 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world-including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies to power their infrastructure. As a Procurement Compliance Manager you will work with teams across AWS, leading projects and initiatives that look to reduce business risks to AWS across a large, global portfolio of infrastructure deployments. You will work on cross-organizational projects focused on remediating identified business risks within the procurement space (i.e. processes, policies, systems). You will not stop there but will take lead in special projects that require a high level of attention and/or quick delivery time with an emphasis on operational excellence. You will be involved in expanding the functions of the team across multiple business units within AWS. Overall you will be joining a new team that focuses on governance within our Services Procurement and the larger Data Center Global Services (DCGS) organization that designs, builds, and launches data centers worldwide. Key job responsibilities . Lead various risk remediation projects and initiatives . Manage governance related ad hoc projects . Take lead on identify and recommend necessary mechanisms to reduce business risks . Support the delivery of Governance Program goals . Take lead in establishing necessary controls, mechanisms, and policies to improve DCSP level of compliance . Drive culture of innovation, simplification and continuous improvement through best practice sharing, advocacy and hands-on leadership . Build/prioritize roadmap and drive the tactical execution of key operational excellence (OE) initiatives and resolutions across AWS Infra. . Identify new tools and business processes that simplify, standardize and enable operational excellence . Derive actionable insights and routinely present recommendations from analysis A day in the life There is no standard day for this position. On any given day you could start with a morning meeting speaking with customers or stakeholders in the US and finishing up with a call to EMEA. You will be working on multiple projects across multiple teams, stakeholders and customers. Your biggest customers will be our construction teams especially the cost control and construction compliance team. Stakeholders include teams such as procurement, legal, finance, EHS and more. From time to time you will interact with teams outside of AWS to share lessons learned and best practices. About the team You will be working on an international team with members located across the global representing 5 different cultural backgrounds. Our team is truly diverse and inclusive who is customer obsessed, thinks big, delivers results and plays hard. We are still are relatively new team with lots of opportunity to grow and expand our services/support across the broader organization. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . 5+ years of program management experience requiring data analysis, consulting, creative problem solving, and cross-functional collaboration. . 5+ years of procurement experience preferably in the CAPEX space. . 3+ years of managing cross functional and cross team relationships (eg: finance, legal, construction, procurement etc.) . Demonstrated ability to negotiate and influence internal and external stakeholders to deliver results . Proven track record managing multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously from inception through completion. . 3+ years of experience working on a Global team with members located in different countries and time zones. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . 5+ years experience as a program manager leading projects within the procurement, compliance, risk management, or process management domains . Experience leading multiple projects simultaneously. . Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes. . Exceptional analytical, quantitative, communication, and presentation skills . Strong written and oral communication skills. . Preferred work experience in a fast paced deadline-oriented work environment . Ability to deal with ambiguous problems and build solutions with proper project management Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Richemont owns some of the world’s leading luxury goods Maisons, with particular strengths in jewellery, fine watches and premium accessories. Each Maison represents a proud tradition of style, quality and craftsmanship and Richemont seeks to preserve the heritage and identity of each of its Maisons. At the same time, we are committed to innovation and designing new products which are in keeping with our Maisons’ values, through a process of continuous creativity. Talent, Talent, Talent is our main motto! Being part of the Human Resources Team will bring you into the most interesting side of HR: focus on innovation and Talent development. Join us to be #AheadOfTheCurve“ - Regional Human Resources Director HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT? By being a true leader for our Richemont HR function for the South Asia markets (Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, and Australia) and making a real positive impact on our people and business. Your regional HR and Talent strategy is inclusive and empowering your teams to grow and make a change together with you. You are in touch with the markets and your teams, elevating your operations to a new level of excellence with a distinct collaborative and people-focused approach. HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US? Being yourself, you show passion for things that matter and make a positive impact on our people and operations. As a member of the local senior-Executive-Team (Exco), you will be successful when driving and implementing a modern and innovative people-focused vision & approach. To truly make a mark, you will put extra emphasis on: •    talent attraction •    people development •    diversity & inclusion •    securing a modern work environment •    driving digital transformation You will also take the lead in integrating new brands and businesses entering the market, and support the expansion of existing Maisons (e.g. new Boutiques, POS, etc.). You will also be the bridge between the Maison HQs (Geneva and Paris) and the local brand networks between stakeholders and Management in the South Asia region. Achieving a close collaboration between local and global teams, while working closely with (and reporting to) the Regional Director of HR for APAC, will be key to your success! HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING? By providing you great opportunities to make connections that count, to become a part of a dynamic and diverse environment where passion is not scarce and you can count on your team to go that extra mile with you to reach success. This will also be your opportunity to deepen your knowledge of luxury whilst enhancing your expertise in HR and people strategies. Finally, we offer a plethora of opportunities within the Richemont Group and our Maisons to ensure your healthy career development and progression. YOUR JOURNEY WITH US: If your application is selected we will reach out for an informal introductory call. In the interview process with us, we always ensure you have complete insight and transparency, namely, you have a chance to meet and speak to people who will be crucial to your future success. If this all sounds stimulating to you, we are happy to hear from you and hopefully welcome you to our team! RICHEMONT IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
