Job_Title: Senior Associate/Associate, Specialist DevOps Engineer, T&O-EASRE-ENT Architecture SRE, Technology and Operations - (WD29427)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Responsibilities Work with engineering and application development teams to improve system performance through environment upgrades and improvements. You are responsible for managing the CICD tools. You are responsible for the adoption of SRE principles and apply the same on CICD tools. Deployment, support and monitoring of existing and new services, platforms, and application stacks. Measurement and optimization of system performance Capacity planning and management of platform. Evaluate new technologies and solutions to improve system performance. Your responsibility will be to Onboard applications and automate the CI/CD processes. Improve system monitoring and alerting to reduce incident resolution time. Requirements Good knowledge on DevOps Tools, Jenkins, JIRA, Bitbucket, Nexus, Ansible, SonarQube, etc. Experience in managing OpenShift, Kubernetes, Docker, RHEL. Strong in Mobile-Application build and deploy tools for both iOS and Android. At least 3 years of experience of general on DevOps CI-CD tools and managements. Can work under dynamic change environment 24/7 support and have the right attitude to learn and implement. Solid experience in container image deploy and release management with OpenShift and Kubernetes. Must have strong automation and scripting skills - proficiency in shell, groovy & python. Good knowledge on monitoring tools - Prometheus, Grafana and ELK Background in large-scale system administration and familiarity with SRE principles and Release Engineering Have advanced Linux System Administrator skills and advanced configuration management systems skills. In-depth knowledge in infrastructure areas such as virtual server technologies, networking, firewall, internet protocols. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Front End Tech Lead, 12-month contract to perm
Job_Descriptions: Front End Tech Lead, 12-month contract to perm About TEKsystems: We're in the business of building tomorrow. It's not about reading the signs and making sure you're ready, it's about deciding where and how you want to get to the next level. At TEKsystems, we're obsessed with technology. Its power to change everything. Technology fuels our passion and commitment to helping organisations do what they set out to. When we engage, we bring fresh ideas that help you galvanise your performance. Refine your strategy. Spark new energy. The future-and how we get there-depends on those who build, connect, create and transform our world. The most successful and innovative businesses are already doing it, and we're skilled experts at bringing the talent they need to thrive. Job Description: The Tech Lead play a critical role responsible for implementing the front-end logic that defines the behavior of the visual elements of a web application. Actively involved throughout the project lifecycle, often times starting with rapid prototypes early in the design phase. We are looking for a Senior Front-end Angular Developer who is passionate about design and programming. Responsibilities include implementing visual elements and their behaviors with user interactions. You will work with both front-end and back-end web developers to build all client-side logic. You will also be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both sides, and defining how the application looks and functions. Day to day work will not be coding but to provide support to existing teams in terms of: Setting standards Reviewing code Troubleshooting complex bugs Experience Required: Hands-on knowledge of working with angular applications. Demonstrated experience on ability to code an angular app. We will do a coding assessment. Knowledge of end to end tech stack: Front-end, middleware, backend. Front-end analytics experience: User behaviour and activity analytics Site performance and utilization Social media integrations for distribution and marketing AWS experience preferred. For more information you can email Michelle Hoang in our Singapore office on michelle.hoang@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 527369 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/HJs8DR/front-end-tech-lead-12-month-contract-to-perm-itcommunications-unknown-singapore-14826477 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

Job_Title: Skin Therapist cum Consultant [ $1,500 - 1,800 + Comm / Bukit Batok]
Job_Descriptions: Working days: 6 days work week. One weekday off Job Highlights Nurture and conduct regular training and skills upgrade Progressive work environment and empowers and rewards employees Environment that promotes learning and growth Job Requirements: At least 1 year of experience as beauty consultant or in doing facial Proven work experience as a facial therapist and/or consultant. Experience in skin knowledge, consultation, and sales Excellent customer communication and customer service skills Positive attitude and driven User-level computer skills Singapore government-recognized certification (ITEC, CIBTAC, NITEC, CIDESCO, WSQ) will be a bonus. Job_Title: R0102197 Risk - Dev Ops / Production Operations – Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Sandeep Virothu Recruiter View profile & contact The Analytics Expert provides insightful analysis of information, from a variety of sources, to key stakeholders, based on deep subject matter expertise and effective use of an extensive analytics toolkit. The Analytics Expert manages key relationships with functional SMEs on related subjects. They are responsible for developing and updating the analytics toolkit and advising on latest analytics techniques to assist in the delivery of high qualiy insights that with bring added value to stakeholders. The Analytics Expert drives the development of best practice approaches within their areas of expertise. Job Description You will be joining the Platform Engineering team to develop and support the intraday and end-of-day pricing, risk and P&L in Kannon’s expansion across DB.  Responsibilities will include: Implementing new, automated, processes either within, or through enhancements to the bank’s strategic infrastructure or through Strat solutions. Developing solutions and controls to improve integration of the Strats application stack with the various functions across Group Analytics. Working in partnership with Trading, Structuring, Methodology, Technology and Operations to drive the build-out of the strategic analytics platforms. Skills & Qualifications The successive candidate will need to demonstrate a selection of the following: Strong computing and programming skills.  The application stack has a C++ core with extensive of Python. Solid experience of infrastructure and database technologies such as MySQL, Oracle, Redis, RMDS. Relevant education such as an MSc/PhD in a subject such as Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Maths, or Finance. The ability to communicate effectively within a team and across multiple teams and functions. Able to multi-task different projects and prioritise against tight deadlines. Experience of the above within banking or finance and an understanding of cash and derivatives financial products. Additional Job Description Details of the Division and Team: Group Strat Analytics builds applications that solve quantitative problems. The group’s key delivery, a project known as Kannon, is to provide a step-change improvement in the quality of Risk and PnL analysis across many functions including Rates and Credit Trading, Treasury and the Transaction Bank. This is being achieved by providing best-in-class applications and libraries for both live trading as well as end-of-day analysis. It has been funded as a Core Change Initiative at the heart of the DB’s Simplification Strategy. The design, specification and implementation of Kannon is by Strats in close partnership with Trading & Sales, Methodology, Technology and Support groups. The application covers risk analysis and live pricing tools as well as E-Trading analytics. This includes batch, real-time and desktop processing using a single cohesive architecture. The consistency in analytics and the technology platform ensures that no arbitrage can exist between various parts of the Bank as well as rational allocation of constrained resources, including risk budget, balance sheet, funding, and capital. The Platform Engineering team is responsible for the tooling that underpins multiple aspects of the Strats projects including delivering SDLC tools, Test Automation and Monitoring as well as Reference Data management and Grid compute orchestration. It also works with DB Technology groups to provision hardware estate and Control functions to address Regulation and Policy adherence. Your key responsibilities: You will be joining the Platform Engineering team to improve the processes that underpin its successful operation Design and implementation of the deployment of key infrastructure components such as database or compiler upgrades. Maintenance of high-performance applications deployed across multiple locations. Improving the stability of the development and production environments. Support development teams with infrastructure queries. Share in the support rota supporting the practical use of the application in the production environment. Your skills and experience: The successive candidate will need to demonstrate a selection of the following skills: Track record of developing or supporting large applications running on Unix platforms. 2 years or more of experience with Python production level development, including experience with Numpy and Panda. 5 years or more of experience with each of: Bash script development of ancillary processes that support functions such as scheduling, backups, reporting and monitoring. C++ working on interfacing application libraries to databases or other remote sources such as MariaDB or Redis. Maintaining and implementing CI tool chaining on Team-city /Jenkins or other CI environments. Ability to communicate effectively within a technical team and across multiple teams and functions. Able to multi-task different projects and prioritize against tight deadlines.

Job_Title: Director of Trading and Portfolio Management of Energy Trading firm
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Hannah Ong Recruiter View profile & contact Director of Trading and Portfolio Management of Energy Trading firm Director of Trading and Portfolio Management of Energy Trading firm - Exp gained as an electricity trader or portfolio manager is useful - You have knowledge and experience in crafting hourly curves with strong data analysis, price analytics, trading and hedging experience. - Knowledge of the electricity market is a must The co is a start-up in the Singapore energy world, with a mission to transform the energy market, starting with 100% clean and renewable energy in Singapore. It has a mission to switch as many people as possible to clean, renewable energy. They do this by making clean energy as cheap as dirty energy using the latest and smartest technology available.  It uses state of the art technology that helps them distinguish themselves from other utility providers. As the Director of Trading and Portfolio Management, you will be part of the executive team .You will be closely working with the CEO, CCO and CFO in the team. The co manages a portfolio of ~50GWh in monthly contracted supply, ranging from smaller shops to large manufacturing multinationals. Main job functions: -      responsible managing the daily P&L; -      responsible for managing the pricing towards our end customers; -      responsible for hedging and trading our positions; -      setup efficient reporting to the board and other stakeholders, ensuring timely and correct insights into the commodity business; -      together with a small team, take our mission as inspiration, use the firm’s strategy as a compass, and own the company & team goals as a clear short term target; -      develop a vision and strategy for the trading, pricing and portfolio; -      challenge your team to go beyond themselves in reaching joint ambitions; -      responsible for the development, implementation and operation of advanced predictive analytics techniques by the team, that deliver high added value to the organization; -      responsible for establishing a data-driven culture and mindset in your team; -      maintain and improve our financial models for scenario analysis, forecasting and liquidity management; -      setup prudent Risk Management and look for potential beneficial counter parties; -      responsible for designing and implementation of relevant (IT) processes; -      try to take part in relevant commissions as representative for Flo What is your profile? -      completed relevant education, a relevant (energy) technical/finance education is a strong advantage; -      has very relevant experience in the energy market. You have preferably have been an electricity trader or portfolio manager in your previous job; - You have knowledge and experience in crafting hourly curves; - Knowledge of the electricity market is a must - You have at least 5-7 years of work experience in a similar (managerial) position with strong data analysis, price analytics, trading and hedging experience. -      You have an overview; you know how to prioritize and you are decisive; -      You are pragmatic and easily make connections between departments, projects and activities; -      You are a strong leader and project manager with a clear vision on IT and Business Processes; -      Knowledge of gas markets and the Australian markets is an advantage but not a must - You are very skillful in SQL (Postgress) and Excel . Afinity with Python and R is an added quality that is taken into consideration as a strong advantage; -      You feel at home in a young and dynamic organization with ambitious growth targets; -      You have demonstrable affinity with the firm’s sustainable mission What do we offer? -      A challenging start up position with which you can make an impact; -      A lot of freedom and an important role in the team; -      Good salary and career opportunities; -      Working in a young and ambitious team which is entrepreneurial and dynamic To apply, pl send your cv in word doc to resume@cap-cg.com . Pl also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Posted by: CAP Consulting (EA license: 14C7175) Caroline Poh (EA Registration: R1105649) Ad posted - 28 Jan 2022

Job_Descriptions: VP/ Assistant VP, Category Manager, Strategic Procurement, Group Technology & Operations VP/ Assistant VP, Category Manager, Strategic Procurement, Group Technology & Operations Posting Date: 27-Jan-2022 Location: Cecil Street, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Support, define and implement category IT strategies across the Bank, working in close collaboration with IT stakeholders and business functions to deliver a structured sourcing process to optimize the value from the supply market. At the outset, proactively engage and integrate input from respective stakeholders to drive and optimize value generation. Foster effective collaboration and ensure strong communication lines with key stakeholders and colleagues in and across the countries to work towards shared business goals. Develop and strengthen long-term partnerships with key stakeholders. Develop key stakeholder matrix in each category to maintain regular engagement. Track and report savings achievements for areas in scope. Ensure compliance to UOB policies, standards/guidelines. Identify opportunities for improvement from an end-to-end perspective across Strategic Sourcing & Procurement function. Establish appropriate supplier relationship management for assigned suppliers. Job Requirements Degree from any recognised University or recognised establishment (Business, Finance, Engineering or accounting will be beneficial) Professional certifications in the field of Sourcing/Procurement/Supply Chain (e.g. CIPS, CPPM, CPM) are advantageous Minimum 7 years of relevant working experience in driving IT sourcing engagements and negotiating supplier contracts. Excellent communication (written, verbal) and interpersonal skills to positively influence people to make the appropriate decisions and resolve conflicts effectively. Performance-driven balanced with proven success of working effectively in a cross-functional team in an international environment. Process-oriented and possesses a strategic mindset with the ability to have a holistic view. Ability to deliver and articulate a presentation confidently and effectively to a wider project committee and management. Competent in formulating supplier negotiation strategies to address commercial and contractual (includes boilerplates and KPIs/SLAs) aspects. Relevant experience in the financial services industry is advantageous. Knowledge and familiarity of working with e-Sourcing tools and systems Strong project management experience Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

About the opportunity Department description Editorial is an expanding function at Fidelity, and is evolving quickly to meet the needs of our clients. We have a multidisciplinary team of writers and producers as well as a production team to run our multimedia studios in London and Hong Kong. We work closely with our investment colleagues to find the best and most relevant ideas, which our distribution teams then use to engage with our more than 2.4 million clients across Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East and South America. We believe in a show-not-tell approach to our content, and relish working with our investment colleagues to elevate the most unique, useful and unforgettable investment insights for our clients and potential clients. Purpose of your role The Editorial department is looking for a creative video and audio producer with a vision for investment videos and podcasts to work with our dynamic team of producers, shooters and editors worldwide. Based in our Singapore office, we need someone with the right balance of storytelling flair, financial knowledge and technical understanding to give voice to our investment expertise in the Asia Pacific. Above all we want to see your track record of excellence in bringing innovative ideas and endless enthusiasm to help create truly memorable content. Key responsibilities Creatively script and produce investment videos and podcasts for editorial, marketing, communication, technology, digital and other departments across the company Manage multiple production projects simultaneously, from conception to scripting to production to editing to publication Demonstrate a working knowledge of Sony FS5 and A7 cameras for interviews, PTCs and b-roll, as well as of recording online videos through Zoom Display an excellent command of core skills like directing pieces to camera in the studio, office or on location, and act quickly when something’s not right to fix it before it’s too late Demonstrate a track record of taking an average brief and bringing innovative ideas that result in an outstanding end product Understand the technical aspects of planning a shoot, including conducting location recce’s and risk-assessments both on and off-site Travel within the APAC region as a single operator for shoots, and dependably deliver the goods Set up and operate multi-track voiceover equipment using Adobe Audition in the studio and location recorders in the field Engage with internal stakeholders to facilitate the booking of the team, schedules, facilities and equipment Demonstrate competence with the Adobe Creative Cloud; know how to translate great raw material into pacey edits on your Premiere Pro or Audition timeline Make changes to animated templates with Adobe After Effects Identify and work with freelancers in other parts of APAC and be able to direct them to capture your vision Experience and qualifications required Ability to engage with our investment experts in complex financial subject matter. You don’t need to be an investment expert, but you do need to be interested, inquisitive and capable of understanding the subject matter and presenting it in ways our audience will find engaging Working knowledge of Sony FS5 and Sony A7Sii Fluent written and spoken English required. Fluent Mandarin would be an advantage (and any other Asian languages would be pluses) An interest in gear and learning more about innovations that improve workflow and output quality A strong writer with a nose for narrative flow and a well-honed talent for scripting and storyboarding multimedia productions A great multi-tasker who is good at prioritizing; you will constantly be juggling multiple projects A team player who also can take initiative Loads of ideas about new ways to improve our output while being constantly excited by the opportunity to create original content Ability to rig location filming equipment, including tripods, monitors, lighting and audio equipment Familiar with modern studio equipment, including PTZ cameras, sound mixers, lighting desks and vision mixers Experience working with green screen Good level of editing on Adobe Premiere Pro About you About Fidelity International Fidelity International offers investment solutions and services and retirement expertise to more than 2.56 million customers globally. As a privately-held, purpose-driven company with a 50-year heritage, we think generationally and invest for the long term. Operating in more than 25 locations and with $783.6 billion in total assets, our clients range from central banks, sovereign wealth funds, large corporates, financial institutions, insurers and wealth managers, to private individuals. Our Workplace & Personal Financial Health business provides individuals, advisers and employers with access to world-class investment choices, third-party solutions, administration services and pension guidance. Together with our Investment Solutions & Services business, we invest $567 billion on behalf of our clients. By combining our asset management expertise with our solutions for workplace and personal investing, we work together to build better financial futures. Our clients come from all walks of life and so do we. We are proud of our inclusive culture and encourage applications from the widest mix of talent, whatever your age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, social background and more. We are a disability-friendly company and would welcome a conversation with you if you feel you might benefit from any reasonable adjustments to perform to the best of your ability during the recruitment process and beyond. We are committed to being a truly flexible employer, encouraging and trusting our people to perform their role in the way that works best for them, our business, our colleagues and our clients. We offer the maximum possible flexibility over where and when you work for all, considering your role and any local regulations. We call this new approach "dynamic working". Find out more about what we do, our history, our new approach of "dynamic working" and how you could be a part of our future at https://careers.fidelityinternational.com/about-us Applying to this Job Role: Please note you are only required to upload your CV/Resume to the application screen.

Job_Title: Associate - Asia Politics and Policy, Global Counsel (GC)
Job_Descriptions: Global Counsel is seeking an Associate to support the work of its Asia team, with a focus on politics and policy monitoring and research in Southeast Asia, in particular Indonesia. The role will be based in GC's Singapore office, and working closely with colleagues in London, Brussels, Doha and Washington DC. Role and responsibilities Research, analyse and monitor macroeconomic, geopolitical and regulatory trends, with a focus on Southeast Asia, and in particular Indonesia. Support business development by identifying potential clients, and proposing business development outreach campaigns. Produce original written content, including policy papers, published blogs, and marketing material, to build your own profile and that of Global Counsel in Singapore. Support and lead business development initiatives of Global Counsel's growing Singapore office. Skills and profile Between 1-3 years of experience providing strategic and evidence-based advice in a consultancy or corporate environment. Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact Information Security Architect The team The Information Security team at Schroders provide thought leadership on managing the information security threats and vulnerabilities to Schroders information assets and is the centre of excellence for advice and coordination. The team is comprises of various SME's in Technology Risk, Cybersecurity, Insider Security including Access and User Behaviour Management, Security Architecture and Information Risk. What you'll do As the Security Architect at Schroders, you will need to have strong technical security expertise to conduct security design reviews and risk analysis, to identify potential security weaknesses in the design, implementation and operation of infrastructure and applications. You'll work closely with numerous teams across application delivery and infrastructure functions including networks, platforms and end user computing, to define security requirements that contribute to the secure design and implementation of solution, in additional to providing technical security expertise in support of audit related activities. You'll provide consult across the broad spectrum of information security domains, including Cloud and emerging technologies while appreciating the wider global regulatory and cyber threat landscape is essential. Provide guidance to technology and business stakeholders on internal and external audit processes, representing the APAC Technology & Change practices and processes to auditors and ensuring effective appropriate risk reporting practices are followed and controls in place. Provide BAU support for information security services required by stakeholders including but not limited to local admin access, USB access, web URL checks, email quarantine release Participate enthusiastically and effectively in Agile ceremonies with information security, business stakeholders and delivery teams, contributing to planning and resourcing. Champion information security and raise awareness about its role, objectives and initiatives. What you'll need At least 6 years of demonstrable experience on information security architect or related Strong knowledge of security architecture principles, applicable to perimeter defences, emerging threats, DDoS, secure configuration of hardware and software, vulnerability management, malware defences, event log management, access controls, data loss prevention, incident response, penetration testing, cryptography, application security within the SDLC, agile, secdevops and cloud security Experience managing the implementation of regional and global information security projects, initiatives and operational processes in concert with the relevant stakeholders and teams. Experience supporting businesses on impact assessments, security administration, third party due diligence, penetration tests, vulnerability assessments, and security monitoring Ability to present complex solutions and methods to a less technical audience; providing technical and non-technical thought-leadership and education of stakeholders Strong analytical skills and the ability to resolve complex security vulnerabilities and design compensating controls Ability to rapidly find, assimilate and correlate information correctly while under pressure What you'll be like S trong stakeholder engagement skills with the talent to connect and communicate across all levels across the Firm. Comfortable working across technology teams to identify, assess, track and close down regional risks Passionate about developing a career in Information Security Prior experience working in a large organisation or Financial services is an advantage (Job Ref: SIN01481) .
